Reviews.Title: “All about convenience and location!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert V
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to Waikiki beach about 3-5 minutes and a ABC store next to the lobby. All staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Palm style 1 bedroom suite w/ 2 bathrooms. It is outdated but for the price and location, no complaints here. Kitchen does have fully equipt. Small fridge included. extra fee if you want a full size. Microwave, and dish washer which we did not use. Living room has a HD flat screen tv with dvd player. also which mu daughter used was murphy bed. Just watch out for the corner when the bed is down!! Bedroom has 1full size bed with bathroom and 1 flat screen tv with dvd player. full closet. Balcony has two chairs and 1 small cocktail table. partial ocean view. iOvernight valet parking is $25/night. But overall the unit was good. It served its purpose. Would recommend to those people with a tight budget or just need a place to crash and go.

Reviews.Title: “Location over accommodation is how you should decide on this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kanasri
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to Waikiki beach about 8 minutes and ABC store near front door. All staff are friendly and helpful. Interior of rooms are dated and like in 80s including decor, appliances and bathrooms, and you may get a deck, living and dining area very small. For a one bedroom resort, it is very tight, if you use the second fold out bed from the wall, you can't even go to the washr0om since everything is tight. The rooms looks old. Hotel main lobby gives a better look than the rooms that you end up with. Rooms for 1 room suite is very small. 1 double bed only, second double bed is fold out bed located in the living room. when you unfold the bed in the living room there is no room to walk to the washroom. There is a microwave, stove and fridge and sink. No dishwasher (in these days, this is a surprise, where do you not get a dishwasher in a condo style unit). The fridge in our room was leaking water. The ice cube tray is frozen inside the freezer, you can't put anything in it. The TV is HD but the number of channels are maybe 10 or 15. You have to pay for parking at $20 a day (crazy) and it is valet parking so if you leave something in the car then it is a challenge to get it. You have to pay for internet $25 for a week. How much is it to provide this for free, it hardly costs anything? The upside is that you are close to the beach, you can be there in less than 10 minutes. There is an ABC store in the lobby for anything you need but it is very pricy..some items are reasonable and some are ridiculous like the sandwiches are $10 plus. Fruits are insane prices, 3 bananas $2.50. Bottle water is reasonable. You will have to take the location over the amneties with this hotel as you just a boring room.

Reviews.Title: “Location over Facilities”
Reviews.Author: droods
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Waikiki, walking distance from Kalakaua Ave and the beach. The hotel is not a resort, and the amenities are average. A big bonus is the ABC store located on the ground floor - highly convenient. Parking cost us $25, and I believe they washed the car (bonus) but you can find parking along the canal if you want to park for free. The decor is quite old, but the beds were comfortable. The room we had was self contained (kitchenette) which would suit families and those that don't want to have to eat out all the time. Average water views, and we were on the 23rd floor. The most painful part of my experience were the lifts. Being a high rise building (27 or so floors) the three lifts service ALL floors (instead of being split up). What this means is you will wait forever for a lift, which I experienced often especially when getting ice from the machines only located on level 2 or 27 (inconvenient). Overall it was one of the cheaper places which is why we stayed, but Waikiki will always be expensive. You could probably get better value for money elsewhere as there is nothing special about this location other than location and having an ABC store only a lift ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be confused”
Reviews.Author: twrood
Reviews.Content: "We just finished our two week, too long, stay at the "resort" (THIS IS NOT, I REPEAT, NOT A RESORT IN ANY WAY, SHAPE, OR FORM), and as advertised, it is in Waikiki. It's also woefully outdated; bathrooms look and feel like late 60's Holiday Inns'. They remind me of childhood vacations with the parents in South Dakota. Unfortunately, that's not what I look for in a multi-hundred $$/day "resort". Rooftop pool is tiny at best. I wondered about the property when I went to their website before we came, it too looks like it's from the 70's (yes, I know the internet didn't exist in 70's). Turns out the website is on par with the rest of the property. On site restaurant is a Denny's, which seems highly appropriate. Concierge Michael quickly volunteered he could not give any advice on activities not booked through him, guess he didn't want to lose the commission. Such a helpful young man. I doubt other area accommodations charge $50/week for internet access, nor $6/day mandatory fee for the "free" local phone calls. Will say the valet parkers are efficient. Good thing as you're required to use them for a bargain $125/wk (plus tips of course). The "kitchen" (kitchen is a stove top that looks like it belongs in a 60's era Winnebago, microwave, and minifridge that almost freezes ice cubes) sink in our unit started loudly belching water out, eventually discovered an issue in unit above us. Of course, we had to call twice, guess the first maintenance person I asked forgot or something. When we got back after maintenance was in our unit, we were greeted by a sign in hall warning of wet floor, and true to advertising, our floor had a pool of water. Wondered why they left it for me to clean up rather than mop it themselves, perhaps that was another extra charge. If you come here, be fully advised this is nowhere near comparable to nearby properties, and has a host of "gotcha" extra fees. Yes, management was apologetic, and comped internet service and parking for our continued issues, but that didn't improve the nonfunctioning shower in one bathroom, the constant nighttime noise of slamming doors, or the complete lack of any amenities (other than limited selection of DVD's available for the low, low price of $3/night). If you miss those 60's Holiday Inn vacations with your family, however, and cost is no object, this just might be the place for you!"

Reviews.Title: “outdated room...stubbed toes too often”
Reviews.Author: esqjohn
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in midst of waikiki. Loved walking to nearby coffee shops, restaurants and shopping malls. However one bedroom suite was less than desirable. Tiny rooms! Showers were smaller with strange odor from either shower stall or water. Furnitures seem old. At least the beds were firm and comfortable. Stubbed toes too often on wall-floor bedframe in livingroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ryan120
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Banyan Suite on the 10th floor with a lovely view of... the Embassy Suites across the street. The exterior looks okay, but the interior and especially the rooms leave a LOT to be desired. Rooms are in serious need of an update. We will never, ever stay at the Imperial again. There are many other condo-style accommodations in Waikiki. It will be well worth it to pay a bit extra per night than this place. We didn't take advantage of the kitchenette as we only used the room to sleep and get ready since it was so disgusting and uninspiring. This place was a big wrinkle in an otherwise awesome vacation. PROS: - The front desk and valet staff were very nice, attentive, professional, and knowledgeable. - ABC Store downstairs. - 27th floor pool deck was decent. - Location: It's close to A beach. (Not the best section of Waikiki Beach though.) CONS: - When we walked in, we thought it was Golden Girls, but had not been updated since 1987! The green carpeting was old, gross, and faded near the windows. Oh yeah, it was coming up from the walls where the staff has pulled up the carpet to stuff electric cords down there. Isn't that illegal or against some code? The wicker furniture was equally gross, uncomfortable, and in need of an update. - The bathroom was TINY! It made me think I was in an RV. You could use the toilet and wash your hands at the same time. Oh yeah, the "dusty rose" color of the toilet was equally 1987, but hey, it worked. The wallpaper was so outdated. How much would it cost to replace that?! - The bedroom had a hard double bed. You will probably have to walk sideways to get around it and in to the main area of the bedroom. There is about a foot of clearance between the bed and the wall. It just doesn't seem right. - Being on the 10th floor affords no views. Our unit was also on the Lewers side, so we got street noise (with sliding doors closed) from trash trucks and their back up beeps early in the morning. Noise from drunk patrons at Yard House at the mall (Beach Walk) across the street was also annoying. - Location. You will be in the middle of the outdoor mall on Lewers Street, full of mainland chains and nothing of interest. I can go to Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, and Yard House back home... The beach closest to Imperial is in front of the Outrigger Reef. It's not the best part of Waikiki - kind of the outskirts in my opinion. - Hot tubs. We visited the hot tubs and felt like it was a temporary location. There are two backyard style hot tubs on some random patio with ugly/ghetto green awnings. Oh yeah, the hotel workers take their breaks and smoke just below the 3rd floor hot tub area, so you get some great secondhand smoke with your tradewinds. Don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 is nicer than this...heck Motel 5 is nicer than this”
Reviews.Author: KELizard
Reviews.Content: Rust and mold in the bathrooms! This place iis disgusting; and of course " they"re 100% full". This property does not belong in RCI.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii50Lover
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nothing to write home about, but the location can't be beat. We stayed in a 1 bedroom/ 2 bathroom timeshare suite a while back. It had a full kitchen, pullout sofa bed and a murphy bed in the living room. First time sleeping on a murphy bed, and it was an interesting experience, but I digress. It was touted as "sleep 6" comfortably, but I was surprised at how small the unit was. It was a challenge staying a whole week with spouse, two young kids and the IN-LAWS (!). To top it off, there was a lot of construction going on in and around the building. We actually had workers ON/ IN our lanai doing some kind of work the whole time we were there. Since it was Spring Break and the hotel was completely sold out, the management couldn't switch rooms for us. Needless to say, that was a bummer. The great location of the property made up for all the negatives. It was very convenient to the beach, the bus stop, and shopping. There's also an ABC store right next door. The view from the owner's lounge was great but the rooftop pool was meh. We're going back to Oahu in a couple of weeks, but don't think we'll be back to the Imperial of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “The Imperial, The Good and The Bad, Pt.2”
Reviews.Author: mjgriffy
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 1-bedroom that I stayed in for a week (nice). Prior to my friend’s arrival I stayed in a studio for 3 days (horrible). See my other review for the studio. This is the 5th time I have stayed at The Imperial. Room: “Banyan” Unit 905: Light, bright, clean. Peek-a-views of ocean from the deck, but really just views of other hotels (I know from experience, higher floors can have great views). Small true one bedroom with queen bed, and a pull out sofa and Murphy bed in the living room. It could sleep six(!), but it is more ideal for two single friends, or a couple with kids. Linens and beds were clean and comfortable. Kitchenette was modestly stocked with utensils. Convection microwave, toaster, fridge and coffee maker are good for snacks, but I really wish it had a cook-top. In a pinch, you can go to the owners lounge and use their stovetop if you can find pots/pans. Service/Staff: Accommodating. Polite, but not particularly outgoing, warm or friendly. Occasionally a single person at the front desk could not efficiently handle the line of guests. Amenities: Good weight room, sauna and nice rooftop pool. An owner’s lounge on the top floor is a nice place to relax and take in panoramic views. Overnight parking is reasonable for Waikiki at $25/nt. No free Wi-Fi, Lan connection for pay. Location: Premium. The Imperial is an excellent location in the middle of Waikiki. 1 block to the beach, steps to all shopping, restaurants and amenities. All in all, the micro-location and floor level can make or break a vacation, but otherwise a fair value for a clean and quiet home in the middle of Waikiki. As always; I travel to Waikiki several times a year, I can advise that Waikiki is a nice tropical urban adventure. The city comes with the negatives of a big city, along with the overwhelming benefits of a beautiful beachfront resort. Generally, everything in Waikiki is “a little tired” although there have been continuous improvements in the last few years. If you are traveling solo, take Roberts Hawaii from the airport for $12 (no rsvr rqd). Two or more people, take a taxi from the airport to the hotel (should be under $40). In Waikiki, nearly everything is walking distance or a short shuttle/bus away. If you need a car for the day, you can rent one in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean views”
Reviews.Author: Pooky29
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at Imperial. This time, we used time share exchange points to get a KOA room. This was a 1 bedroom with two bathrooms. We also were able to get an upper floor, with almost unobstructed ocean view. We had room 2007 which was a corner unit with south- and west-facing windows. Great to watch the boats and surfers, then to see the sunset. This is a huge improvement to the room we got in 2010 were we were stuck in a low level room facing east (Waikiki Parc hotel). It was spacious for a family of 4. The only issues were the out-dated airconditioning and old windows which did not shelter us from heat and street noise as well as they should. Every morning, we were woken up at 6am with sound of garbage trucks on Lewers Street. The lanai was very small and not pleasant due to all the traffic noise. I have been told that some units have been renovated, but this is not one of them. Kitchen appliances and bathrooms are still old. However, you can't beat the location. ABC store downstairs has been expanded and renovated since 2010. It has everything you need -- very convenient. Staff are friendly, especially the valets who park the car for us. They know us by name and always make an effort to engage the kids. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down bet deal on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: jane1121
Reviews.Content: Ok so yes the decor is old. It's like staying at Grandma's beach house. For the money there is nothing even close to the space and amenities. We stayed with four adults in a 1BR, 2 Bath. We had a small balcony with ocean view Over the Halekulani. Steps to my favorite spots on Waikiki. Beach Walk, Hilton Village, and the Banyan courtyard at the Sheraton. Convenient foot wash in the garage on the way to the beach. Surf Leason shack right there!! We kept the fridge in the room stocked which made it easy to refresh drinks while not losing our spots on the beach. One of us could run and bring down a couple more rounds. We did microwave some oatmeal for breakfast at first but the went to a market and ate fresh fruit the rest of our stay. (not much cooking) The pool is small but who swims there when at the beach?! We ordered salads to go one night and ate on the balcony of the owners lounge. It was the cheapest meal with the best view our entire trip. Look at other places with these amenities on Waikiki and you will easily double or triple what we spent. We bought our week outright from an owner listing on VRBO and he charged us $100 per night. Suddenly pastel colors and ratan furniture didn't look so bad to us! The owners lounge, location, and view sold us. I think people complaining must not get to Waikiki often enough to appreciate what a hidden gem this place is!

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat this location”
Reviews.Author: LovestoFly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with friends as they are owners of this TimeShare Property. The location is top notch. Lots of shopping, restaurants, entertainment all right outside the front door. The ABC store located in the lobby is larger than most with food, beverages etc. The beach is only a few minutes walk away. You can walk to most places very easily. The owners lounge is a nice gathering place with pool tables, TV, Kitchen etc. The pool is small and on the 27th floor and its breezy up there. The bar on the top floor isnt open every evening but if its open dont miss it. The view is spectucular and the drinks and decor is top of the line. I only wish the rest of the resort was a nice. The rooms, decor, furniture were old and dated and need of total renovations. We had a two bedroom and two bathroom unit. The master bedroom had 2 double beds and its own bathroom & balcony, the other bedroom was very small only room for the bed & closet. Both rooms had flat screen TV's in addition to the large TV in the living room. The living room & dining room were large complete with balcony. The appliances (coffee maker, toaster, microwave) were new. The refrigerator was very small and the stove top & oven I have havent seen since the 70's. Even the thermostats units were old and outdated. the staff was helpful. We only found valet parking available at the hotel so between paying for the parking ($100 per week) and tips daily it gets pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: duncanboy1
Reviews.Content: Myself, my two sisters and our cousin stayed here for two weeks in April. The building location scores a 100%, it is perfect. Two minutes walk to the beach (just across the road and down the beach walkway). ABC store and Denny's in lobby. Surrounded by stores and restaurants and only a two minute walk to the main street. The rooms are comfortable and clean but tired and in major need of remodelling. The owners lounge is very comfortable if you do have a late flight. There is comfy couches, TV, kitchen with tables, pool table. There is also a bar upstairs that has a amazing view, it is just too bad that it is only open on week nights and sometimes closed if they have a private function. I love the fact that this hotel is very reasonable and is surrounded by hotels that cost at least twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever”
Reviews.Author: Gail W
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 friends stayed at the Imperial for 15 days on a RCI exchange and had the best time ever. Right in the heart of Waikiki. We stayed in a studio room on the 26th floor next to the owners lounge which was very comfortable. Had a great view. Had everything we needed.Very friendly and helpful staff. Everything in walking distance. We used the bus service and tour buses and everything ran on time!!! Bus service has been voted #1 in the US and I believe it. We used the pool alot on the 27th floor. Very quiet and relaxing compared to the hundreds of people on Waikiki Beach. Would definitely stay at the Imperal again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PrettyKitties
Reviews.Content: We traded into the Imperial through RCI. Overall, we were very pleased. As others have said, the location canʻt be beat. Itʻs right in the heart of Waikiki with an ABC store in the building and beaches are just across the street. We were in unit 1104, which is a handicap unit, so the layout was a little different. As everyone says, the decor is dated and tired. But the unit was clean enough and everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. There are only 3 elevators & it can be a bit of a wait sometime. Laundry facilities on the second floor were serviceable and reasonably priced. There is a footwash available in the back of the building, which is great after being on the beach. We were on the Diamond Head side & I didnʻt have any issues with the noise, although there was a jack hammer one morning. Because we traded in through RCI, we were able to use the owners lounge on the 26th floor, which is a very nice perk. The lounge is at the front of the building and has a kitchen, large screen TV and pool table. Views are terrific. We were able to use the lounge after we checked out on our last day, which was great since we had a late flight. Because of the late flight, I requested a late check-out & was given the room until 6:00 for $66, which seemed fair. It was nice to be able to use the room after exploring Honolulu for the day. After we checked out, they were able to store our luggage until we left for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Can you keep a secret?”
Reviews.Author: Roman-Irka S
Reviews.Content: The Imperial Hawaii is one of those places that I would classify as a well-kept secret. My wife and I stayed in a one bedroom unit for two weeks in March and let me tell you that dollar for dollar it can't be beat. If you travel with a budget in mind then the Imperial is the only choice. The staff, whether at the front desk, housekeeping or valet, was always very friendly, courteous and always willing to go that extra step to make you feel welcome or assist you. The unit was clean, quiet and comfortable. The bed provided a comfortable night’s rest and the kitchen was amply equipped. Location, location, location. How can you go wrong being right off of Waikiki Beach. The Beach is just a short block away and a great place to spend the day reading a book, snoozing, swimming or walking along the beach. After a day at the beach, you can return to your unit and either enjoy a home-cooked meal prepared in your personal kitchen or simply walk to some of the best restaurants in the area. The area offers a wide variety of cuisine in a complete range of prices. Like to shop? The hotel is located right in the middle of shopping mecca; from the International Market to specialty boutiques. The roof-top swimming pool is a favourite place for sun-worshippers to gather. On an exchange? At the end of the day, go upstairs to the Owners Lounge, mingle with fellow travelers, take in a beautiful sunset and even watch fireworks (usually on a Friday). Bang for the buck? Our buck stops here.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent the rest not so impressive”
Reviews.Author: diane16523
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in this place. IT was an exchange from my existing timeshare in Cancun. I was hoping for similar to what I have in Cancun but that did not happen. We had a 1 bedroom Banyan suite. It has a queen bed in the bedroom ( looks more like a full bed) a full murphy bed, and queen pull out sofa (horribly uncomfortable). We had 3 adults and my 4yr old daughter. It was a tight fit. They say it is good for 3 but really 2 is best. Not necessarily a family place... I did not get a welcoming family feeling especially when I took my daught to the roof top pool. We were in 802, I personally did not sleep well our view was of the back alley and trucks start coming in about 4 am. The tour busses are coming in about 6 am. It is very close to the tour bus pick up location at the Sheraton just right around the corner in alley so that is convient for touring. There is no kitchen just a convection microwave, small sink, and mini fridge. We ususally prefer to cook ourselves. THere are tons of restaurants in a very short distance. Cleanliness leaves a bit to be desired. THe floors are dirty looking, the decor is old. They only come once a week to clean your room. The rest of the time you have to go down to housekeeping to request new linens and pick them up. Ice machine is on the 2nd floor in the garage or the 26th floor. Upon Check in if you have an exchange they have to take your credit card info for a $100 deposit up front. but it was not charged to me just the daily room tax. If you have to print anything at the front desk it is $.50/page. With the owners Exchange you get access to the owners lounge on the 26th floor which is nice and has a nice view of beach. THe staff was nice but not outgoing but you could tell they had good relationships with the people who come often. The tour concierge Michael in the lobby was very good and booked everything for us. Through him I recommend on your first days take the majestic circle Island tour and the Polynesian Culture Center tour. They show you places you will want to go back to the rest of your trip. Would I use this place again If I had not other options but I would have to get a larger suite if one is available because the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great service/location but dumpy room”
Reviews.Author: marlySF
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week at the Imperial (corner of Kalia and Lewers) in Waikiki. This was our 7th trip to Hawaii and 4th trip to Oahu. One of us stayed on Lewers Street 30 years ago (in a place since torn down) so it was quite interesting to see the changes. The location (across from the Halekulani on the beach side and Roy's/Trump/Embassy Suites across Lewers) is hard to beat. Just steps from the beach and in the middle of all the *happy hour* activity in the area. Plenty of places to eat, drink, walk, relax, etc. Also, our favorite haunt while there was the ABC Store down below. You can get everything there --- food to fix in the unit, juices/alcohol/souvenirs/clothing ---- everything. That ABC store became like home to us during our stay. There are also some clothing/jewelry/souvenir stores adjoining the lobby, as well as a Denny's which we wouldn't normally eat at but the rain was so heavy while we were there that we actually DID eat at the Denny's one night and the food was pretty good. I can't say enough about the bell staff. The regular desk staff was good but the bell guys who you work with to move your car back-and-forth OR to call a cab ---- OUTSTANDING. Friendly, polite, efficient, helpful. They don't get any better. I loved those guys. We rented a car for two days (parts of 3 days --- 48-hours) and because we got the unit on an RCI exchange (thus I guess we qualified for a timeshare parking rate), we paid $20 for two days of parking. Obviously, we gave the guys well-deserved tips. It was cheaper than I expected and so easy to leave the keys with the guys. The hotel has a pool up on top and a couple of hottubs on the 3rd floor, along with a sauna and fitness room there. We didn't use any of those as the weather was so awful --- constant rain. But, they are there and we did check them out. We paid for the DSL internet. The Imperial didn't have wireless available. Internet was $15 a week which we were happy to have since we needed to change all our plans, due to the weather. Very handy to have access for a lot of quick Googling. As far as the unit, we got what we reserved (an RCI trade) and it had many amentities (Palm unit --- 2 baths, 2 flatscreen TV's, DVD players, full kitchen, 2 extra beds as fold-outs, etc.) but, frankly, it was a dump. Except for the new Mr. Coffee coffeepot and the flatscreen TV's, everything else in the kitchen was very old and dated. The stove and dishwasher and microwave looked so old, I didn't use them. Fixtures are dated. Cabinets are very dated and cheapo particle board. Furniture and tile and bath counters were very old and looked dirty or very tired. There was a huge chip (chunk out of) in a bath counter. It's possible that the unit we had was one which had never been upgraded as we did see pictures of other units in the building which were more modern and less tacky. Also, there are a lot of mirrors in the unit which make it look bigger than it was, in the advertising. Our unit (2004, on the 20th floor) is about 520 square feet (we measured it) and did have two tiny balconies, but the unit backed out to the Waikiki Parc and the Sheraton (with a small ocean view between the Sheraton and the Halekulani) and seemed to be in an elevator shaft-type space. In other words, down below were the generators (and garbage-collection centers) of all the high-rise hotels and we could not open the balcony doors without being overtaken with a huge roar of noise. All in all --- we appreciated the location and the staff (and the comfortable bed in the tiny bedroom) but our unit was a *blast from the past* (old and tired) and not relaxing. We're not so picky on the view but it would have been nice to have a little more quiet out on the balcony, so that we could open the patio doors without being blasted with high-volume urban generator noise. Maybe they'll upgrade unit 2004 soon? It sure needs it.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: DBOUCH
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks here in Waikiki. The imperial is not the fanciest hotel but a great location. Having a full kitchen while in Hawaii works great for us. The hotel can use some updating but it is clean and staff is great. Worth the money. The hotel is a small walk to the beach, one small block. There are grills on the beach which we used often for both lunches and dinners. There are many supermarkets nearby, I recommend the Food Pantry. Close, clean and reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “As Everyone Has Said, "Location"”
Reviews.Author: Hornet_441
Reviews.Content: Can't say any more (or enough) about the location, it's perfect. Close to everything you need in Waikiki, incuding the beach. The hotel (or resort, however you want to describe it) is an older building but is clean and comfortable. We stayed in a Palm suite for a week (Interval exchange) and it is quite comfortable for 2, not sure I would want to stay with 4 and definitely not 6 as advertised. Other big pluses are ABC Store on site (although you can find 20+ more within a 10 min walk), Denny's on site (a tad expensive but open early), owner's lounge on the 26th floor has magnificent views (yes it is available to exchangers, no it is not available to renters). About the only negative I can think of is although they have 3 elevators, they are all pretty slow. All in all the Imperial helped make the first Hawaii vacation a very enjoyable one. The hustle of Waikiki was fun, off to the Big Island for a quieter second week (Kona Coast Resort review coming soon).

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Waikiki - 50th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: 73Elaine73
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was upgraded to an ocean view by someone in reservations. The view was spectacular. We rented a car and felt the conceirge desk would have preferred that we book our tours through their services, not very helpful at all. Best advice we received was from our rent a car agent at the airport. Three wonderful places for dining were recommended. Also, used the Internet, Trip Advisor for other places to see & dine. Breakfast @ the hotel was $30 pp and dinner $60 pp. A bit pricy. Do not go @ Christmas, it drizzeled everyday except one.

Reviews.Title: “The Imperial, The Good and The Bad, Pt.I”
Reviews.Author: mjgriffy
Reviews.Content: Preface: I booked a studio for 3 days for myself. When my friend arrived I moved to a 1-bedroom for a week. See my other review for the 1-bedroom. Service/Staff: Accommodating. Polite, but not particularly outgoing, warm or friendly. Occasionally a single person at the front desk could not efficiently handle the line of guests. Amenities: Good weight room, sauna and nice rooftop pool. An owner’s lounge on the top floor is a nice place to relax and take in panoramic views. Overnight parking is reasonable for Waikiki at $25/nt. No free Wi-Fi, Lan connection for pay. Location: Premium. The Imperial is an excellent location in the middle of Waikiki. 1 block to the beach, steps to all shopping, restaurants and amenities. Studio room, Unit 301 : Clean but Horrible. Dark, dank, depressing and noisy. Located 1-foot from housekeeping’s door, 3 feet from the staffs changing room, and next to the sauna, spa, and gym, doors were always banging/sqeeking, opening and closing 24 hours a day. The patio of 301 was covered with a tarp. No light, no view. Situated on a alley, workers on smoking breaks could be heard at all hours. This room should not be available to guests. It should be storage. In fact, all rooms on the 3rd floor should be avoided. At over $100/nt, there is no value in these rooms. If I had to stay more than 3 days in this room, it would ruin a vacation. Please see my other review of Unit 905. As always; I travel to Waikiki several times a year, I can advise that Waikiki is a nice tropical urban adventure. The city comes with the negatives of a big city, along with the overwhelming benefits of a beautiful beachfront resort. Generally, everything in Waikiki is “a little tired” although there have been continuous improvements in the last few years. If you are traveling solo, take Roberts Hawaii from the airport for $10 (no rsvr rqd). Two or more people, take a taxi from the airport to the hotel (should be under $30). In Waikiki, nearly everything is walking distance or a short shuttle/bus away. If you need a car for the day, you can rent one in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Fair accommodations great location.”
Reviews.Author: jpatrickr
Reviews.Content: Typical timeshare with need for update. Nice staff, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PeterEmerald
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights with family (2 aduts, 2 teenagers). One bedroom with fold down bed in lounge was cosy, but as the location was excellent, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. Roof top pool was good, as was the bar / lounge on level 27, especially for a viewing the Friday night fireworks from the Hilton Village resort. Decor is a bit dated, but great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinaGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my daughter and her friend as it was in close proximity to the beach and across the road from where we were staying at the Embassy. For the price paid ($111 + taxes and service fee) it offered a good budget alternative. I stayed one night when my daughter was ill to look after her. Her room on the 10th floor overlooking Lewers Street was very noisy and showed signs of age and neglect.There was rust on most of the bathroom fittings and the sheets and towels were worn, faded and stained. However, the room itself appeared to be cleaned well, though the carpets were overdue a steam clean. A friend stayed on the opposite side of the hotel though overlooking the Sheraton and this side of the hotel was much quieter and from the balcony (and pool deck) offered great sea views (Floor 21). Security was lacking somewhat as the keycard access on the elevators had been disabled meaning anyone could access floors. Housekeeping was sporadic as was front desk service. Overall a good hotel for anyone wanting a cheap, no frills hotel close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: krissy1103
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night but the place was a good value. The elevator was high tech but when I walked into the room, seems like the kitchen was stuck in the 80s. Ancient oven, decent microwave and fridge, Wicker furniture. Some parts of the bathroom seemed unclean- it was bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent studio suite, great location”
Reviews.Author: ninja25
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Imperial for 5 nights and i must say, although my first night's experience was less than ideal, the subsequent 4 night stay definitely made up for it Pros - excellent location - behind the Halekulani and at the doorstep of wonderful restaurants on Lewers street/Beachwalk ( eg Roys), you can't beat this place for location. It is very close to the beach, close to trolley stops (including the pink line shopping trolley to take you to the Ala Moana shopping centre) - spacious studio (Ohia suite) - sleeps 4 (although this would be cramped - better for 2 people), standard fit out but very good kitchen facilities, large balcony - in room safe/iron/ironing board - comfortable Murphy bed - courteous and helpful staff (see below) - great deals available - $95 per night (pre-taxes) (via booking.com) Cons - i do not recommend the rooms on level 3 adjacent to the Housekeeping area - due to the volume of foot traffic (staff with their trolleys and coming in and out of their changeroom, and guests - to pick up extra towels etc), it was very noisy. To the Imperial's credit, when i pointed this out, they changed my room the next day As previous guests have stated, the rooms higher up definitely have the better views I did not use the pool/sauna so cannot comment (and as the beach was so close by, i didn't feel the need) All up this is a place I would definitely stay at again. It is not a 5 star hotel (and is not pretending to be) - but stay here if you value convenience and amenities at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Imperial”
Reviews.Author: Amanda C
Reviews.Content: We love to travel! And we love a good hotel. This was not the best place we've stayed but it was very good. The room was big enough and the ammenities were acceptable. The price was excellent and we were right in the thick of the Waikiki night life, close to the beach and a million places to eat. The highlight of our trip was Chase Hawaii Rentals, where we were treated as if we were family. They hooked us up! Spent 8 hrs riding Harley's around the island! The customer service was outstanding! A big mahalo to Nick! We strongly suggest that if you need a bike, car, scooter or wanna go with the big bikes that you go thru Chase Hawaii! Next time we will rent for the entire stay. Over all, a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: MukeshSingh
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel as it is close to beach areas and lies in mid city area which is close to all facilities around with stunning views from the top floors. Some good shopping centres, restaurant and bars are around here. Good value of money as you can get cheaper room, studio type with kitchen facility to suiteroom.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable place, superb”
Reviews.Author: LONNOY
Reviews.Content: Really well furnished, great pool on the 27th. We were on honeymoon 250010km from home, 12 hours time difference. People were very kind, service was great. Shame it's so far away from France, otherwise we would come again. We'll try. And after a week here we went to Big Island but can't remember the name of the hotel there. We were the in december 2005 but in the select window you have got that year

Reviews.Title: “still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pbrownie64
Reviews.Content: we stayed imperialfor the 2nd time this yeatand it as still as good as pefore the location is so good next door and across the road fron trumps roys ruth chriss chans all within 1 block the staff were great we would like to go back

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jaymack46
Reviews.Content: This "timeshare" hotel is a bit tired but is clean, comfortable and affordable. The service was excellent from the valets, the reception staff and the housekeeping. The suite was large and comfortable and has two TV's and CD/ DVD players. Air conditioning was adequate.Kitchen area was well equipped and cooking facilities were good, but the bathroom was tight.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay to be close to everything in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: maxxy_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights. First in a studio and then a 2 bdr apartment. Both rooms were fine but tired. The 2 bdr definitely in need of a renovation. The swimming pool is great but it is windy on the 27 th floor. The owners lounge has great views, computers & lots of comfy chairs. The imperial has broadband at a price but no wifi. The bar on 27th floor is open to public on some nights & is a must do for the view & cocktails. Staff were very good re any issues. Denny's & an ABC store are on the bottom floor. Some rooms can be quite noisy with the trucks coming to the hotels in early hours of the morning. The beach straight in front of the Outrigger isn't great but go to the next bay on your left or walk a bit further on the right for a lovely beach. Plenty of shops & places to eat right beside the Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: vitsippor
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here years ago because it was the only thing I could afford when I was very young and broke. Now I go to Hawaii once a year or so, sometimes more, and still always stay at the Imperial for at least a part of my trip because the value is tremendous - I have paid as little as $100/night. The hotel is ugly. Not gross, just ugly. Some rooms have weird blue carpet, pink toilets, dishwashers from maybe the early 80s, wicker furniture. The rooms vary - some are atrocious, some are quite a bit nicer. There is a small pool on the windy rooftop rather than a lovely pool with lounge chairs by the beach. But it is clean, the rooms are very spacious, there are a lot of suite options, the location is fantastic, some of the views are great and the prices are amazing. I don't typically spend much time in my hotel when I'm on Oahu so why bother with a more expensive place? The staff is pretty remarkable as well. Check in is always very slow - I have no idea why - but the valets are great and so helpful. But what impressed me most happened in December of 2008 when all of Oahu had a blackout. The Imperial staff was in the lobby handing out flashlights and radios and had an elevator operator to bring us up to our rooms. They were just wonderful. It's not romantic or beautiful or stylish. But you can't find a better deal anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: jan h
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Sept 17th through Sept 24th on the 20th floor it is the time share of a friend. I thought that the room was fine a little small, but sofa sleeper was horrible my husband and i switched from the murphy bed to just sleeping on the couch everynite. It is very close to the beach and the central pick up for activities is just behind the resort. Dennys and the ABC are right there so any small items you might need you can get there(but expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Really good value with OUTSTANDING views!!”
Reviews.Author: YYCMommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Imperial in August as a timeshare. We were in a one bedroom with 2 bathrooms and a kitchen. The rooms itself was clean, clean, clean! It was a bit old but certainly comfortable. The location was really good, just behind the Halekulani and the Outrigger Reef. An ABC store located in the hotel as was a Denny's. Just across the street was Beachwalk which was very handy. Our room featured was a corner unit with tons of huge windows with a panoramix view of the ocean. Watching the sunset from this location was breathtaking. My kids loved the one elevator that had glass to the outside so they could look out. The pool on the top floor was a good size and was nice and warm. We swam in it on the days that the jellyfish were in the ocean. The service was exceptational, they were attentive and always followed up with us. I would stay here again if the chance presented itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair condition, priced right.”
Reviews.Author: morningbird303
Reviews.Content: All in-all the Imperial Waikiki was a good find. It was cheap, clean-enough and in a central location. Because of the size of the unit & mini-kitchen, I wouldn't suggest having more than 4 adults in a 2 bedroom unit or stay for a long period of time. A little more about our stay; A total of 6 adults decided to catch a last minute flight to Oahu to see Pearl Harbor after spending 6 days on the Big Island. We booked one night (Sept 2011) in a HALA SUITE 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit directly with the Imperial Waikiki, at $210 per night. We didn't have high expectations of the Imperial after reading other reviews, but we chose this hotel because it was in a good location, cheap, knowing we would only sleep & shower here. Driving to the Imperial was a bit of an adventure, the hotel is situated in the city near shopping so lots of people walking, tour buses & one-way streets to navigate around. After finding the hotel, we handed the keys to the busy valet attendant (parking in the garage is $25 per day charged to the room). Hotel check-in was friendly & quick, our luggage was delivered to our room within minutes by a friendly employee. Our room was very basic, small, outdated (80s) and "fairly-clean"....it definitely needed a good scrubbing. The kitchen area is NOT really a full-size kitchen as they indicate on the website however it had the basics: a mini-fridge, a really old full size stove/micro combo, coffee maker & almost no counter space....you wouldn't be able to easily cook a meal. Also, we were on the 9th floor and could hear the noise of the street (honking ect). The noise wasn't bothersome to us, but could be if you are sensitive to sound or are a light sleeper. After passing our bedbug/rodent inspection we all quickly showered (The bathrooms were tight, but not as tight as in europe and water was nice & hot) and were out exploring Waikiki within 30 minutes of our arrival. In the downstairs lobby there is a cheap ABC Store, a couple of cheap souvenir/clothing stores. Directly across the street from the Imperial there is the Embassy Suites & Outrigger hotels and down the street there were lots of high-end chain stores, Fendi, Cartier and chain restaurants including PF Chang, Starbucks, etc For dinner, we ended up at the Shore Bird restaurant at the Outrigger overlooking the beach & Diamond Head. Drinks were nice and strong & the staff was friendly. We watched the sunset while eating a large salad buffet and steaks we were able to grill ourselves! After dinner we stepped onto the beach to watch the fireworks before returning to our room. The linens were crisp and beds comfortable-enough. The next morning we were up early & headed downstairs to Denny's. Sometimes Denny's is questionably, but the food here was good, coffee fresh and staff was attentive & friendly. Personally, I do not plan to return to the Imperial, or Waikiki at all. It was crowded & had the hustle-n- bustle of a big tourist city...... ...the peacefulness, beauty & tranquility of the other Hawaiian islands is sooo much better!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lyn C
Reviews.Content: A little bit dated but really clean and we had a one bedroom unit which had a separate lounge which was great, we had a side view through the Halekulani to the water, heaps of towels rubbish taken daily. The pool is just ok it was too warm for us but who cares the walkway to the beach is just out the back of the hotel providing excellent swimming and their are loads of restaurants in easy walking distant you are right in the midst of everything. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: StatenIsland56
Reviews.Content: Excellent place with pool on roof (27th floor). Location is 100 yard walk to beach. Halekulani is between Imperial & beach. Denny's on ground floor for nice breakfast. Ray's across street is fine dining with open bar to street. ABC store on ground floor too. Convenient but pricey. Plenty of shopping on Lewers St. Starbucks in two directions: one diagonally across in Outrigger front area; the other a block & half up Lewers, same side as Imperial. Both Halekulani & Outrigger have fine dining & drinks possibilities. Room was small but adequate. Murphy bed & sofa. Gym on 3rd floor. Great for one or two. Also have largercrooms in building. No complaints for price. Good value. Considering the price of surrounding hotels, it is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but had to deal with many issues there!”
Reviews.Author: Mcguire13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to find a hotel that was near the beach, reasonable rates and comfortable. Well, this hotel was cheap that's for sure, and next to the beach, but that's pretty much all it was. I would have to say you get what you pay for here! The first few nights were hot in the hotel because the whole air conditioning system was off. It did come back on after a few days, but it was still too warm. Then they decided to do some plumbing work and had the water shut off all night for a couple nights. It finally came on around 8:30am so we could shower, but it didn't come on when they said it would around 7am. Also later on in the week, in the middle of the night, I would say 12am to around 3am, there was strong pounding sounds coming from the inside of the walls. We called and complained and they said that they were still working on the plumbing and doing then. What? Who works on plumbing pounding on pipes all night long when people are trying to sleep? So anyway, it was cheap and near the beach, but really not cheap enough for all we had to deal with. People were friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY RUDE”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm91
Reviews.Content: Actually did not stay at the Imperial, but usually visit Hawaii annually. This year we stayed at the Outrigger Reef just across the street from the Imperial, which was great and will write a great review for and highly recommend. However, the worst part of our 10 day vacation happened at the Imperial. We rented our car for touring Oahu and stopped at the ABC Store located at the Imperial. I really thought the drive in front of the ABC was for ABC customers and did not see any sign posted saying for hotel customer parking only and did not realize there was the valet at the end of the drive. I parked the car in front of the ABC and our friend went inside to get a bag of ice and I got out and went to the trunk and get the chest ready for the ice. As soon as I opened the trunk, the young Imperial Valet came to me and told me to move the car. I said "okay, just give me a second here." He yelled, "Move the car now!" I had drink bottles out and started trying to get them together. I said, "okay," but he continue yelling "move the car now!" Of all my trips to Hawaii, I have never been treated so rudely. On every island, I have also been treated as a special guest by everyone. This is the first time anyone has ever been so rude. I made a mistake by parking in the wrong place. I did not do it intentionally. I did not leave the car. I will never stay at the Imperial because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tigersfan68
Reviews.Content: I've never had a problem with this place. My in-laws have a timeshare here and let us use it on occasion. It's in the heart of everything, shopping, dining, entertainment and the beach is a block away. The staff are always friendly and helpful. There is on-site parking for $20 and if you need a cab they can get one for you within a matter of minutes. The activitiy center has been shut down and will be turned into a deli for the ABC Store. The furniture and artwork are a little outdated but so what. The only complaint I have, and it's really not a big deal, is the bathroom is pretty small. The pool on the 27th floor is nice, they moved the hot tub to the 3rd floor, the exercise room and sauna are on the 3rd floor also. We've always enjoyed the Imperial and will continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WaOz1
Reviews.Content: My first impression was a bit underwhelmed, but once I overcame being in a city which means crowds and noise anyway, it's actually a nice place to be. The gym is really well set up. The room itself is just OK, but the location is phenomenal. I'd stay here again, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: jhollywd
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret in Waikiki. Located right behind the Halekulani on Ocean Walk, there is no better locaton. Many rooms have ocean views and are appoint well with kitchenettes and multiple flat screen TVs and a DVD player. The furnishings are a little dated and the pictures in the room are faded (which might subconscuiously give you a cheesy feeling). Nevertheless, this place is worth every penny paid. It is a timeshare so it won;t have daily maid service. However, a short trip in the elevator and you can exchange your towels and linens twice a day if you wish. There's an ABC store right downstairs so you can get food or drink any time from 6am to 11pm. There's also a Denny's, Roy's, PF Changs and Subway within spitting distance. One drawback is that they charge for WiFi (wired) in the room.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot find a better location”
Reviews.Author: craignsandra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not fancy, but is clean, good service and the location can't be better. If you are using the timeshare and have some down time be sure to check out the owner's lounge. The view is beautiful and it is a great place to just relax or hang out with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: madhawk23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Waikiki. This Resort is a fabulous location, being on Lewers st. Rooms on the high floors(15th floor and above) have ocean views. The Banyan suite has a separate bedroom and the lounge has a murphy bed(pulls out from wall) and also a sofa couch/bed...a dining table and it has a kitchenette (but no oven-only a microwave) Easy walking to the shops of waikiki and only 2mins to the beach... Restaurants are good in that area as well..PF Changs, wonderful chinese. Arancinos, in Beachwalk..fantastic pastas and pizza. and a short walk to the Chessecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen and Marguaritaville. Down side is that the beach is not very big there and not as clean as the other end of waikiki.....but it only takes 10mins to walk to the better water if you want to spend all day on the beach, its worth the walk. all in all..i loved it there...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic condo in great location”
Reviews.Author: Anejo-y-Coca
Reviews.Content: I can’t believe the Imperial doesn’t get more love. I mean, it’s in a fabulous location, smack dab behind the luxurious Halekulani and only 1 short walk from the beach. It’s in the heart of Beach Walk which makes the location convenient for dining. We’d walk around the Outrigger Reef between the Army museum and be on the beach in less than 5 minutes, and the beach in front of Ft. DeRussy is wide and less crowded. The condo units are nothing fancy. I’ve rented various condos in various buildings over the years in Waikiki, and they all have been very similar, typically small and built in the 60’s or 70’s. Nothing different here. The Imperial is extremely clean and the kitchens are small but functional. You only get maid service once halfway through your stay, which is fine with us. Towels, including beach/pool towels are provided and you can swap your towels out with housekeeping for fresh ones every day if you want. Our trash was emptied quite a few times. There are laundry facilities on the 2nd floor and a fabulous owners’ lounge on the 26th floor. The view from the big balcony on the 26th floor is breathtaking – also a great spot to watch the Friday night fireworks. There are two rather new hot tubs on the 3rd floor as well as a small fitness center with cardio equipment, weights and mats. One could easily get a decent workout in while staying here. Off the lobby downstairs you’ll find an ABC store as well as a Denny’s, great for 1 a.m. rolling-in-from-the-beach-bar-munchies. Parking is $25/day (OUCH) or $100/wk for owners. WiFi is $15 per week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: douglasrob
Reviews.Content: Traded our time share week for the Imperial though RCI. We were impressed from arrival by the service and the friendliness of the greetings. We got a 17th floor one bedroom suite with a partial ocean view. Yes, the decor is dated, which hardly registers on the negative scale. The furnishings were more than adequate for a very comfortable stay. The suite had two flat panel televisions and dvd players, two baths and could accommodate six with a pullout couch and a murphy bed but it would be very crowded. The bed in the bedroom was reasonably comfortable. The hotel features wired internet for a fee, however I opted for service from a wireless hotspot from an adjacent hotel through Skywave for $24 for the week. Parking is valet for $25 a day but they offer a $100 for the week package. We enjoyed the pool deck, despite the fact that pool is small. All in all an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: robinvan
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Imperial again this year after staying last year around the same time. This hotel is a little bit dated but has quite a charm about it as the people are very friendly and helpful. The location cannot be beaten and there are two fabulous restaurants just steps away in Roy's and also House Without a Key at the Halekulani. If you want good value for your dollar and not a high end hotel, this is definitely the place for you to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Kamaaina weekend trips”
Reviews.Author: mercadesohana
Reviews.Content: All in all a clean hotel with a helpful staff. we live in kaneohe and were celebrating my sons 6th birthday at d and b's, so we decided to make a weekend of it If i had a negative it would be no maid service on stays less then 3 days. The pool is heated at night. Being that it is on the roof that was nice. The lock on our sliding door was broken, we did not realize it until 11 pm at night. being we have young kids this was a problem. i spoke to the front desk and it was fixed right away.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: Cairo777
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time to trade my time share for this hotel. Location is great! Next to Trumps tower, Halakulani, embassy suites, Dennys, Roys, great stores and coffee shops.. Staff is friendly, pool is nice ,beach next door, jacuzzis are good. The hotel itself is outdated, beds and pillows are not the most comfortable, but overall it's perfect for the location.. Don't stay here if you need high end amenities.. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could turn back time”
Reviews.Author: dgy010
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, I realize this is a time share property and many people who trade to stay here, do so because it's "Hawaii." That being said, I wouldn't suggest turning down Hawaii if the Imperial is the only chance you'll have to experience Waikiki. If not, and you have other alternatives, I would take a pass on this place. I stayed in the studio which may have led to my not-so-great experience. The 1,2,or 3 bedroom options are probably a little better. The studio did not have a bed. It only had a roll away (which was probably from the 70's and completely uncomfortable) and this "thing" that came down from the wall that they call a bed. It's probably a full size bed type structure which was also extremely uncomfortable. That being said, I did not sleep very well during my stay. In fact, 1 night during my stay, I went on priceline and paid for a hotel room just so I could get a normal night of sleep. Some of the pro's of the property: the staff is good and the location is good (pretty central to everything in Waikiki) Con's: it's an aging property and it shows, towels (bathroom and beach) were disgusting, uncomfortable beds, cleaning service only once per week, and dirty furniture. When it comes to travel, everyone has varying opinions and I realize that. What I would suggest to anyone who reads this is: ask yourself "have I ever stayed at a luxury hotel like four seasons, ritz, JW, etc?" If you have, don't stay at the Imperial. You will be completely let down. If luxury brands aren't your thing, and your used to staying at days inn and motel 6, then this place won't be so bad. Finally, the valet guys were great and were probably the highlight of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pbrownie64
Reviews.Content: just back from 7 days at imperial hawaii vacation club arrived early room was ready and clean staff were just great location is realy good we hope they will have us back soon

Reviews.Title: “Great location and bellmen”
Reviews.Author: hawaii98
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 19th floor KOA (1bdrm, 2 bath) oceanview unit on a timeshare exchange (specifically an Interval International Get-away, which made it a steal of a deal) So this review reflectsI stayed in a 19th floor KOA (1bdrm, 2 bath) oceanview unit on a timeshare exchange strictly the timeshare unit not the hotel rooms. The location is fantastic, right across the street from the Halekulani, Beachwalk and Roy's restaurant and close to the beach. The building and my KOA unit were definitely older but clean. The bellmen are very friendly and helpful. A word of caution if the availability of the gym is a big issue for you: 1 of the 2 recumbent bikes was broken on the day I arrived, and by the 4th day they were both broken. So that made 3 of their 7 pieces of gym equipment broken with an unknown fix date. ("needed parts from the mainland") Do your own research on trip advisor re: activities before you book through their activities director. I went to the Paradise Cove luau with other guests at The Imperial and we thought it was a joke; do not assume the activity director is steering you to the best vendor and not just one that earns more commission. She never even asked me for any details when I complained about the luau, which leads me to believe she already knows about all the complaints. If you book the circle island tour make sure you know where the stops are and for how long. Normally the advantage of taking a smaller tour (van with about 12 people) is that you visit less of the touristy sites. However our tour parked us at Kualoa Ranch in their restaurant/gift shop for 1 hr yet planned only a drive-thru in Haleiwa (a much better stop for food and shops) and Waimea Bay. To David's credit he did stop for me in Haleiwa so I could get a shave ice at Matsumoda's since the waiting line was short, and at Waimea Bay so the Australian couple could get a picture for their grandson.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SCNate09
Reviews.Content: We were on Oahu for a football game between my alma mater and the University of Hawaii. I stayed here on a timeshare exchange basis so I can't speak to their rates. It is what I consider a very typical Waikiki hotel--somewhat dated but who really cares because you're never in your room. The location was excellent--a block away from the beach and a block from Kalakaua on Lewers. The biggest drawback by far was the comfort of the bed and pillows. I found the matress to be very soft and the pillows were too voluminous for my taste. On Friday night a group of immature young men checked into the room directly upstairs from us. They partied like they were 14 years old and their parents had left them alone for the first time. In addtion to the noise problems, they were smoking in their non-smoking room and the smoke was finding its way into our room through the duct work. Hotel management evicted them or relocated them at 5am Sunday morning after losing two night's sleep and our fourth complaint. Management might have acted quicker, but I can't fault them for the actions of the young men. I thought the staff was friendly like almost everyone in Hawai'i; although, our interaction with them was very limited as were either in our room or off property. My wife liked the surf board storage offered by the property. If you're looking a basic room with a great location in Waikiki you would probably have trouble doing better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and value for a relaxing, vacation on Waikiki.”
Reviews.Author: karenaclassic8
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner at the Imperial since 1985 and I wouldn't trade it for any other location. Yes, it is old, but it has been kept in good condition, with lots of up-grading done in recent years. I know the pool deck is not posh or even upscale, but I'm not interested in pool activities-I go to Waikiki to enjoy the Hawaiian beach & views. Yes, some of the units on lower floors are small and little view-but we don't spend time in the rooms except to eat, sleep, clean-up, eat in when we want to just relax, change clothes, etc. Why pay hundreds more for a posh hotel when you don't use it any more that? The location is great-a short walk across the street to Waikiki Beach with a beautiful view of Diamond Head, Outrigger Hotel with several great eateries and entertainment; & entertainment at the Halekulani right on the beach is very professional & Hawaiian. A nice walk along Kalakaua Blvd takes you to shops, restaurants, more beaches, the zoo, a park with lots of activities, shows, etc..The staff at the Imperial can assist in car rentals, tours, shows, luaus at discount prices; they'll assist in giving info on cultural activities in the city as well as Waikiki area; and the convenience ABC store is handy as is Denny's downstairs. There's also laundry facilities, surfing lessons/boards available. I would recommend the Imperial for families, singles, and couples because it is in a great location, has affordable prices and a very happy, knowledgeable staff willing to help day & night. They'll go the extra mile for you if it is possible for them the help make your vacation a happy memory.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: busy925
Reviews.Content: I must stay i was very leery about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews. My sister-in-law was in charge of securing our lodging accommodations, and she selected the Imperial Hawaii Resort. I was not comfortable about staying after reading all the negative reviews. As a back up, i booked a room at the Turtle Bay Resort. Well... to my surprise the Imperial was lovely. Nothing like the reviews stated. I immediately checked out of Turtle Bay and stayed with my family at the Imperial Hawaii Resort. Not a luxury hotel, but certainly not a motel (as some of the reviews implied). Awesome location. A short walk to the beach, and shopping (directly across the street from the Embassy Suites). Simply a nice hotel. We stayed on the 25th floor and our room was great. Sofa bed not too comfortable, but which sofa bed is.. The murphy pull out is very comfortable. Some complained about the noise... What noise? I didn't hear a thing. Yes.. an few delivery trucks, but it certainly didn't stop me from sleeping. I would certainly recommend this property. Oh... did i mention I work in the hotel industry. Keep in mind; it is very difficult to please service industry people because we expect so much. After all, we're constantly going over and above to exceed our own guest's expectations, and we expect others to do the same. This hotel was fine....

Reviews.Title: “Great location … rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Pooky29
Reviews.Content: Travel dates: July 3-10/2010 This was our second week in Oahu having spent the first week at Hilton Hawaiian Village (Hilton Grand Vacation – Lagoon tower, 1 bdrm). We got this unit through a timeshare exchange. We had low expectations of the unit since we knew it’s a much older building but with a great location. What we liked: Very convenient location for shopping, beach, food choices for a family. We went to Denny’s for breakfast and ABC store downstairs for snacks and supplies. We walked to the beach by Fort DeRussy or Waikiki area (in front of Sheraton very easily. Lots of high-end shops, souvenirs within 1-2 blocks. Royal Hawaiian Centre is also within 2 blocks. We went to the foodfair a few times to have noodles, Chinese, Korean and Hawaiian food. Because this is our second week in Waikiki, we decided to rent a car for a week. Parking at Imperial can only be done by valet. We paid $100 for the week. In general, staff were very friendly and always greeted/smiled at us. With the car, we bought groceries at Ala Moana and wet to other beaches (Ko Olina lagoons, Kailua, Waimea). If you are a timeshare owner, you have access to owner’s lounge on 26th floor. This is really spacious and had nice decor with a full kitchen, dining tables, lounge areas, and lanais. There is a full ocean view and good place to watch fireworks. This really came in handy on our last day after checking out to relax, eat take-out dinner and use the shower before our flight. We should have used this area more often since our unit was so small. If our unit was updated like the owner’s lounge, we would have enjoyed it more. What we didn’t liked: We were in unit 902 (1 bedroom) which faces east (view of Imperial Parc’s deck). This is a lousy view and we felt that we had no privacy. At any time, someone could walk onto the deck. We had to keep curtains in the bedroom closed most of the time. Sine this was over July 4, they were full and were not able to change our room. Mid week, they said a unit was available in a higher floor, but on the same side of the building. We would have to pay $50 cleaning fee if we wanted to move. We decided to stay. If you are booking at Imperial, you should request view of Fort deRussy side (west side). If you are high enough, you can see Hilton’s fireworks. If you end up on the Waikiki Parc side, request a room higher than 9th floor so you’re not so close to the building and right at their deck level. The unit itself is small. Living room contained a sofa and a separate Murphy bed. When the Murphy bed is out, the eating table and sofa/coffee table area is really cramped. The bedroom only had 1 night table and it was hard walking to the side of the bed facing the window. The bathroom was tiny as well. There is very little space to dry off and stand in front of the sink. Fixtures were all older. We thought we had a full kitchen but this unit did not have a stove/hot plate, only microwave, sink, fridge (with a freezer that did not work), coffee maker. This is fine for having breakfast, snacks and take-out food in our room. We have relatives who have timeshare in higher level units which have been updated and they have raved about this building. Our unit has obviously not been updated (but very clean) and really needed new curtains, bedding, carpet, bathroom fixtures. However, there is only so much you can do with the layout, which will always be small. Internet is not free. I think we paid $25 per week to use the wire connection in our room. Self-parking is not available, a bit inconvenient since you have to load and unload your car in the front drive way, in full view of everyone. Our son fell asleep in the car on the way back one day and we had to wake him up in the driveway (versus letting him sleep in the parking lot with one of us in the car). The small pool is on 27th floor rooftop is not inviting at all. After being at Hilton Hawaiian Village with their waterslides and large freeform pool, we didn’t want to even go into this pool. It was surrounded by walls with windows, so there isn’t much of a view. We spent most of our time at the beach so didn’t need the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Totally UNDERrated!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jourdanzlife
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed from July 8-13th, 2010. My Husband and I were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary. Had we looked to Trip Advisor to be the overall voice, or to a large degee, the final say of where we stayed, we would have missed the opportunity to save a dime, forcing us into a more expensive location, possbily ruining a wonderful week in Hawaii by spending more money on a room and forego the activities we had planned. Understandably, there are thousands who visit this time timeshare, and only a few hundred, who when dissatisfied over the slightest thing, are willing to write a review. Thankfully, we decided to be our own judge and are glad we took the steps to do so. The Imperial Resort is centrally located and situated in the perfect spot for all activities and shopping. We stayed in room 2508. Arguably, one of THEE most beautiful scenic rooms offered. The rooms are clean and not as small as the other reviews claim they are. Is the furniture outdated...not really. If you compared it to a 5star resort (SUCH AS TRUMP) possibly. It didn't have cascading water falls in the lobby and the rooms didn't offer large jacuzzi style bathtubs, but the feel I got when I entered the room, was simply...Hawaii. I didn't get the impression of being in a cheap hotel by far. It's valued high for the money you spend and comparable to being in any other resort in the area. Personally, I rate it to be a 4 1/4. Why the 1/4?? ...because my experience of timeshare resorts are slightly different in the fact that I'm used to having an "in room" laundry facility and at least "starter" coffee/tea packets offered in the room. Other than that, they accomodate everything I've seen stylish resorts to offer. They have in-room maid service conveniently offered on certain days and you have full access to xtra lines/towels during extended business hours. You have access to an in-house massage therapist and the spa area in very relaxing. I especially like the security they have with reaching your rooms, which means you need to meet your guest to take them to your floor. It takes a key card everytime you access the elevator...completely eliminating the possibility of children pushing buttons to see them light up. (Nice to know in a hotel that has 27 floors.) My husband is an Officer with the State of California and raved on that piece of security. His overall experience was so profound, he will be recommending this location to his friends and co-workers. (You would have to know my husband to know that's a BIG DEAL :) ) I suppose if you check the trip advisor for Trump Towers, they have bad reviews also...which goes to show, for the money, you just can't please everybody. I totally recommend you take the opportunity to see for yourself. In my opinion, You won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “PENTHOUSE II 2802 - IMPERIAL WAIKIKI - Great location and right price.”
Reviews.Author: mas68
Reviews.Content: The Imperial Waikiki was the right location at the right price. 50 - 75 yards from the beach, just across the street. Our room was Penthouse II 2802. This room had the elevator shaft near the master bedroom and the elevator motors could wake you up at night if you are a light sleeper. The hotel has 28 floors, floors 16 - 28 facing south or west should have views to the beach. There is an ABC store and a Denny's attached. It is on Lewers street and is a very nicely renovated street with lots of new stores and foot traffic. It is clean, the lobby is simple similar to a holiday inn. It was priced comparable to hotels two blocks away from the beach, this one is very close to the beach so we got it and were not disappointed. If you pay to much, then you might be disappointed. Parking is 25/day.

Reviews.Title: “In the Mix!”
Reviews.Author: tpenadiaz
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long stay at The Imperial. My husband and daughter (5 yrs) and I enjoyed it very much. The location is A+, right by the Halekulani and Outrigger Reef, across the street from Waikiki Beach. Yes, it is true, the property is aging, but we did not find it horrible at all. Everyone (staff and guests) were friendly and in a good mood. We stayed in a studio - Murphy bed (nice and firm mattress) with a futon - my daughter slept there. Our view was of Lewers Street - great for having a beer on the lanai and people watching (3rd floor). The room had a good size mini fridge, coffeemaker, toaster and microwave. All utensils included. Room was very clean. So was the bathroom. Just had a shower stall, but no big deal to us. Good closet space and nice flat screen TV with DVD player, so we brought some movies from home to watch. We are originally from NY, so yes it was noisy, only really bothered us in the very early AM when trucks were making their deliveries, but you want to be up early anyway and enjoy all that Hawaii has to offer. The convenience of the ABC shop downstairs is the best. We did find the Walmart on Oahu and bought our milk, bread, beer, chocolates, from there b/c ABC is pricey, but in a jiffy, it was convenient. And don't forget to try those coconut M&Ms...you will love them. Ok, the pool is cheesy and the hot tubs were not the coolest, but you are right on Waikiki Beach - just go there! GREAT views of Diamond Head - your pictures will totally rock. The Imperial is also right on Beachwalk, this new pedestrian friendly area with shops and places to eat - very nice with all of the lit tiki torches at night. You can also walk to the Royal Hawaiian Center - more shopping and people watching. Great location the Imperial - you are in the mix of Waikiki Beach. I recommend that you eat at Duke's at Outrigger on the Beach and try Eggs n Things on Saratoga Ave - THE BEST MACADAMIA NUT PANCAKES AND OMELET I have ever had in my entire life. All in all, I would stay at the Imperial again. It is not the fanciest or prettiest, but the location is fantastic and it was totally satisfactory for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Aging Property”
Reviews.Author: 1961dawn
Reviews.Content: This was a 20th anniversary celebration for my husband and I and if we had not read the reviews prior to our trip, we would have been very disappointed with the Imperial. We ended up staying at the Imperial because there were no other options available through our timeshare (Worldmark/RCI exchange). Check in was smooth. Our room was adequate. The bathtubs weren't very clean. The rest of the room seemed clean enough, but the room and furnishings are all very worn and aging. The location of the property was great. One block from the beach and right on the new beachwalk. We didn't open our balcony because of the street noise. As long as it was shut, the noise wasn't a problem other than the trash trucks waking us every morning. We weren't interested in sleeping in, so it was fine with us to use them as our alarm clock. We had a great week and the room didn't detract from the wonderful time we had. The on-site trip planner was helpful. We booked a couple of tours (island tour and snorkeling) with them. Don't know if we could have gotten better deals elsewhere, but weren't interested in shopping around. There is an ABC store right outside the lobby door. Not the cheapest prices I'm sure, but very convenient. We didn't rent a car, so can't address the parking. We used the bus most of the time. I can't whole-heartedly recommend the Imperial because of the dirty tubs and the very outdated/worn room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Desert77
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week, the room was dirty when we got there, but the staff took care of it quickly. The hotel is close to everything, but it is OUTDATED and the pool area is an eye sore as well as the 2 above ground jacuzzi's that they have. The room was nice, but again, very dirty. The staff was very nice. I would rate the hotel a 2.5. Parking was 26 a day along with a 6.00 resort fee, also they charge for internet usage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: dlinds5555
