Reviews.Content: We traded our week from our timeshare on Maui for a week at the Imperial. Rooms below floor 19 basically have no view at all (our original room had an alley and a cement wall for a view from the lanai). All of this after waiting 5 hours for our room to get ready. Front desk personnel tried to be helpful but could only do so much. They recommended we contact reservations and see if they could help. After being on hold for 20 minutes (she argued that it had only been 9 minutes) the only resolve was to upgrade at $30 a night! Rooms are dated. No stove and only a micro fridge. Internet is not wireless and costs $5 a day or $15 for the week. I would not trade my timeshare for this location again. Valet parking is $100 a week. It is close to many shops and restaurants. All things considered, I am not impressed with this property at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but good value”
Reviews.Author: aliehssunday
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. The beach and eateries are a stone's throw away, which is an important factor for me. This hotel is not the Ritz, nor did I expect it to be, but it was a great value. I traded my week with RCI and stayed at this hotel, room 2001. Yes, it was small and cozy, but clean and comfortable for me. I had a lanai with a partial view of the ocean. I enjoyed the large, flat screen TV in-room. The 26th floor owner's lounge, was a delight; there were unobstructed views with a wrap around lanai for amazing sunrises and sunsets. Conveniently, there were computers on the 26th floor too. I especially liked the 2 hot tubs and sauna on the 3rd floor. They were very relaxing. There was also a small fitness center, but didn't use it. The staff was so accommodating and helpful. They make this place shine. Mahalo nui loa! In short, I was pleasantly suprised by my RCI exchange and am happy to have stayed at the Imperial Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in 2 star hotel in Mexico that are better then this hotel”
Reviews.Author: achaez000
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, dirty uncomfortable. The walls are peeling, the carpets are dirty. Overall the room is not what I expected, I will never recomend or comeback this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, now if it was a little updated....”
Reviews.Author: dimplebrandy
Reviews.Content: I am torn about this hotel, I LOVED the staff, but wasn't impressed with the room. The room has a "full" kitchen but with a mini fridge and NO freezer ?!?! HUH ?? How can you call it a full kitchen if the most important appliance isn't fully there ?? The bathrooms were tiny, no counter space, no drawers and no room. You opened the door and it banged right into the shower bar....which I guess is good or it might've hit the tub. Also you have to pay for internet , where most other hotels are giving it for free. It was a good connection, though. Better than the other hotel we stayed at. The pool was very tiny, but on the roof which was cool. BUT the valet service was amazing!! Great Guys (and girls?). So prompt and on the ball. The other employees were polite and friendly, as well.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it, definitely a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: ShanaH
Reviews.Content: I really think this is a hidden gem! We were a military family moving from Oahu when we stayed at the hotel. I did alot of research to find a reasonably priced, clean hotel for my family to stay at. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and the rooms to be very clean. We had a one bedroom suite with a kitchenette. Our room didn't have a view, but we weren't in the room except for at night. The hotel has everything you need or is located near somewhere you can get it. Definitely look at this hotel, we absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Make your own adventure.”
Reviews.Author: g0blu
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at IW in late April 2009. I recommend this hotel for people who are just looking for a place to sleep and willing to venture out beyond the hotel for activities. You cannot find a better priced hotel in a better location. Two of the best restaurants in the islands are within steps (Roy's and La Mer). A huge new shopping center is practically attached to the hotel. You are surrounded by the Sheraton, Embassy Suites, Halekulani, and Royal Hawaiian. Beware of fees. At the time of check in, the internet was free in the Owner's Lounge. By the time we left, they had switched it to pay for $5 per day ($15 per week.) Tax is somewhere between $4-8 per day. Parking is $20-25 per day. This cost (for us at least) was completely worth it. You have to have a car to get to all the great little nooks and crannys of the island. And you simply must make a trip to the North Shore, making a car important. The rooms were clean and adequate. The maid service was very good. The kitchen was great (although it is quite a jaunt to a "real" grocery store, SafeWay.) Very few of the higher floor rooms were available due to maintenance, and almost no rooms have a view of the water. Do not waste your time and energy trying to push them to give you water view. Overall, it was a good value and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Manage your expectations and this place will be great.”
Reviews.Author: ChinaShrek
Reviews.Content: We just finished a week at this resort. We exchanged our timeshare through Interval International for this resort. The Imperial is mostly a timeshare resort. However, some rooms are marketed through the Imperial website for individual nights. This distinction is important because it will directly effect the room that you receive. Timeshare guests get the best rooms. Our room was on the 24th floor. As previous reviewers have stated, you need to be on the 20th floor or higher to get a view of the beach. You will usually pay more for ocean views at resorts / hotels in Waikiki. So, we were exceedingly pleased with the view from our room. People who pay for their room by the night (non-timeshare guests) will not have a nice view from their rooms and should not expect one. Furthermore, as a timeshare property, there are certain housekeeping practices that take place, which are common to timeshare resorts. Rooms are cleaned once per week (even if you pay by the night) and if you stay less than 3 or 4 nights then your room may not be cleaned at all during your stay. Trash is emptied each day and dirty towels were replaced during our stay each day. From our room, I was able to pick up a free wireless signal for my laptop. Others may not be so lucky. This resort is not a 5-Star resort and does not market itself as such. It was built in the 1970s and has not undergone major renovations since then. However, small improvements have clearly taken place. Our unit had two LCD flat-screen TVs (one in the living room and one in the bed room), for example. The microwave was also new. Most of the other items in the unit (the carpeting, couch, chairs, stove, etc) were definitely more than 20 years old. Everything worked and was clean at check-in. The staff was very friendly. The valet parking is $20.00 per day ($25.00 per day if you not a timeshare guest). We thought this was a very good value. Our car was always brought to us within 2 minutes! If you just want to stay on the beach, then I would just take a shuttle from the airport. We did lots of sightseeing since this was our first time in Hawaii. As many people have stated in other reviews, the location is excellent. I would be happy to stay here again if I was exchanging my timeshare. I would not pay more than $150.00 per night, however, if I was paying cash. You can get much nicer (and newer) properties in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Outdated Resort”
Reviews.Author: kristie074
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very dated. One of the three elevators was down for rehab for the entire length of our stay while at the resort (there are 26 floors) which made getting to our room take a long time as the two operating elevators were often too full. The room was small and never got vacuumed for the four nights we were there. Also, the pool was very small, and the rooms had no view. Plus, if you do want to use the internet, you either have to go to the 26th floor or to the 2nd floor to access it which is a little hassle. However, with these things being said, the location of the hotel is great as you are in the heart of the beachwalk. In addition to this, we found the service to be very good at the hotel as well. For instance, every night whenever we returned to the hotel, the lady at the front desk (Tiana Lakanaria) always welcomed us back by name which made our six-year-old daughter feel very special. Tiana provided great guest service as did the valets. I would not fault the staff for the short-comings of the hotel as they do provide the best in service that they can, and we found them to be very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Bargain Hunter!”
Reviews.Author: WyomingMomof3
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect condo for the bargain hunter heading to Waikiki. We just returned from a week stay. Wea re a family of Five - 2 adults and 3 kids (15, 12 and 9). The best feature is the location - 1 block from the beach and in the heart of Waikiki shopping and dining! Lots of options for meals from Denny's to Ruth's Chris all in one block. Of course you can also buy food items at the ABC convienece store attached to the condo and cook in your room - very nice after a long day a the beach and not wanting to go out! Very reasonably proced condo - we had the one bedroom/2 bath and it was perfect for us. Do not expect any extra room for spreading out but we did not spend much time in the condo - mostly just slept there. The worst feature is the parking - $20/day for timeshare exchangers or $25/day for others and only valet allowed. That got old! No view from lowers floor but you can get all the views you want from the beach or Diamond Head. If you are looking for 5 star go elsewhere - if you are looking for a decent place to stay while saving your money for excursions, suveniors, meals out this is perfect. I would give it a 3 star. Clean - no bugs, no smells, nice place!

Reviews.Title: “The Location is great”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaFreeFlier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Imperial in a Palm unit (1BR, 2Bath) through RCI exchange. We were on the 15th floor. Only owners are assigned to rooms above the 20th floor, which you need to see the ocean. The bedroom bed and the queen size Murphy bed were very comfortable. The bathrooms need updating. The location of this resort is exactly what we wanted. We could walk to everything in Waikiki. The beach is accross the street, shopping is all around, you can jump on the trolly. You don't need to worry about transportation. Denny's offers carryouts and they were very fast - we ordered carryouts for breakfast and ate them on our balcony. The ABC store has whatever you forgot or need. The owners lounge is beautiful and huge. There is not a hot tub and we did not use the pool. The laundry is on 2nd floor and has a balcony to sit and wait. The Timeshare presentation is not high pressure. Actually very good prices for the resales. We recvd a one day car rental for attending the presentation.

Reviews.Title: “So bad we had to end our stay early even though we paid for the week!”
Reviews.Author: KCnNickel
Reviews.Content: The positives: The location is amazing!! The computers with Internet access and owners lounge with pool table are great. Unfortunately, the carpet and room smelled moldy. Every time I went in the room I felt ill and felt better after I left. There was also no hot water for 2 days. After we finally realized that the hotel was literally making me sick, we booked a new hotel. Although we had paid for the week, we packed our bags and stayed at the Wyland. We were so appreciative to be in a clean hotel (the Wyland) with hot water!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Getting what you paid for, bad”
Reviews.Author: fastchevytruck
Reviews.Content: Love this place, close to the beach, the staf tries to keep this place up as best they can. They seem to have problems with giving your room away though, we were suposed to be in the 24th floor room(great view) when we got there, they gave our room away to someone else, and gave us the room with the view of Dennys Resturant roof, When confronted about this they lied about what happend, nice place, Bad Management....... I accually am a time share owner with this place, I will be using Hawaiian Timeshare Exchange to tranfer to other places in the future....

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Imperial”
Reviews.Author: IheartWaikiki
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Imperial again, it's perfectly located and whilst it is a little dated, I didn't mind, I love sleeping on the pull down bed, and watching TRU TV til the wee hours with the sound of the ocean. My room was clean, and fresh. The maid service did a great job every fourth day. The front desk couldn't be more helpful and supportive to my needs. The lifts are being serviced, and this was a lttle inconvienent, but all in all I had another great stay at the Imperial. If you are wanting luxury and decedance - go somewhere else, the Imperial doesn't claim to provide this, it provides a great centre of Waikiki experience. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing going for the place!”
Reviews.Author: PinkSurvivor
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend at the timeshare in a 1 bedroom. Small rooms with a murphy bed, microwave - the outdated mirror wall did not add to the size. The lanai looked at the back or roofs of the NICE hotels in the area. Construction of the elevators, NO hottub & a DIRTY pool area!! Denny's & an ABC store on the street level added convenience for our stay. For a sunset, go to DUKE'S. Eat outside & save on the cost of food. LOCATION, LOCATION is the ONLY thing going for the Imperial! Just remember - Waikiki is NOT the real Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Location Main Reason to Stay at Imperial”
Reviews.Author: Austher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 7 nights at the Imperial through our timeshare. Our room was a one-bedroom, two-bathroom suite on the second to top floor of the Imperial. We certainly couldn't complain about the size of the suite--it was spacious, and in addition to the bedroom and 2 baths, had a kitchenette (a trip to the market saved us some money on food), living room and dining room area. The room was relatively clean and the bed was comfortable. The furniture is defintely outdated and a bit tacky if you care about those things. We did not. We had a view of the ocean, which was partially obscured by a couple of other high-rise hotels in the area. The view was still pretty nice. Guests get access to the owners lounge which has internet access and there is a pool on the roof. The pool scene was definitely NOT happening and it was largely deserted. But since you're in Hawaii, why go to the rooftop pool, right? The hotel allows you to check out beach towels which was great. One complaint I have is that the housekeepers come to your room early. And in some instances, they kept knocking even though we had the Do Not Disturb sign up. Another complaint is that there is no parking structure or lot. It is all valet, which means you get charged a daily valet fee. Bottom Line: The Imperial is a decent stay (nothing special), but the best reason to stay here is that it really is surrounded by everything you want to see. Just one block from the beach, and two blocks from the strip. There are plenty of stores, restaurants, etc. to see within close walking distance. So based on location alone, I would be willing to stay at Imperial again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Idaellen
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us in a Banyan suite which had only 1 bathroom. As we were on holiday that didn't prove to be much of a problem. The pull-down bed was reportedly comfortable. We found the staff to be very helpful. The location is excellent. The room is a bit dated but I'm told a refurbishment is underway. The use of the free computers was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ShazzaPerth
Reviews.Content: We (Family of 4 including two girls aged 9 & 10) recently stayed at this fabulous location. A timeshare resort which is located one building from the beach. The amenties were great we had a 1 bedroom apartment whihc had ocean views from the balcony( side views). The staff were freindly and the condition of the property was excellent. this would have to be one of the best timeshare resorts we have stayed in. The apartment had a full kitchen and the owners lounge had the best view in Waikiki looking stratight out to the ocean with no buildings to interrupt the view. A two minute walk to the beach, shops close by, $1.00 to wash & dry clothes in the common laundry the list goes on This is definatley a place we will come back to

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: nbhurst
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Oahu, and the Imperial. We love this location! Now that the construction is done on Lewers street it is beautiful and has a lot more to offer as far as shopping and restuarants. The views are beautiful from the pool deck which is on the top floor. We stayed in a Palm (which is a room with a seperate bedroom and has two bathrooms and a kitchen) which was very clean. They came and got your garbage every day and replaced towels. It could use some updating in decor but everything was functional. You would want to be as high up as possible as this will improve your view of the city and ocean. It is just a short walk to the beach (one block) It is very close to the International Market and Waikiki beach where you can watch the surfers or take out a catamaran. So much to see and do! The Imperial also offers the services of a conceirge who will book excursions to the Polynesian Cultural Center in Laie and to various Luau's.

Reviews.Title: “It was doable”
Reviews.Author: mdlvc
Reviews.Content: We got a reservation over Memorial day week as a timeshare exchange. I read in previous reviews that if you are a timeshare owner, you get better treatment. It doesnt hold true (at least for us). I went in with a positive attitude about this place and considered all the nice reviews posted on this site. I requested a high floor in advance and the lady I spoke to was very nice and said they'll do everything to try and accommodate our request. We were assigned a PALM unit on the 9th floor. I said to myself, well this isnt a high floor but I didnt say anything. My heart sank as soon as we opened the room. The room was not only very outdated, it smelled outdated too. Our room was on the back of the building which gave us a nice view of the back of the adjacent hotel and the parking lot next door. Needless to say, it was dark and gloomy. We immediately called the front desk to try and see if we can get a better room but the receptionist was not helpful. He told us that they are fully booked and that there is nothing they can do about it. They said to try and call again in the morning. I tried to not let it ruin our vacation so we immediately unpacked and started heading out to the beach. WHen we returned later in the evening and were getting ready for bed. I pulled out the murphy bed from the wall so my 5 year old can sleep on it. As soon as I did, the dust came flying out of the wall, when you peek in the space between where the bed was and the wall, it seemed like no one cleaned it for ages. The dust was very thick. Since we were so tired, we made our best to tough it out and get a good night rest. For the next couple of days, we pretty much just stayed out of the room, only to go back and sleep. On our third day, my husband went down to the front desk to see if they can change our room but the receptionist was again unrelenting, he said he cannot do anything. My husband asked if there's anyone he can talk to, it just so happened that the manager was walking by, he then explained the situation and he immediately resolved the problem. We got a KOA room on the 15th floor. I found it to be cleaner, brighter and much more roomier. It didn't matter to us that both showers didnt have enough hot water pressure (almost like a trickle) so we took semi cold showers until the hot water started running like normal again towards the end of our trip. Just as I was about to say, this place is not too bad, another incident happened. We came back to our room after spending time on the beach and found that the door was left wide open. It looked like someone fixed the beds but forgot to clean the rest of the place. The garbage was not picked up nor were our towels and toiletries re- stocked. They just made the beds and left. (Remember, if you're checking in using timeshare, you only get the room cleaned once a week). After checking the whole place, we found that nothing was missing (thankfully) but we called immediately and security was sent to our room and had our door re keyed. The hotel has apologized but it really just wasnt acceptable for us. The only perks I can agree to is that the location is very good. You're within walking distance of good restaurants and shops. Valet service was great and friendly, giving us good directions all the time. They have a good selection of DVD's in the lobby that you can rent for $3.00. ABC store is conveniently accessible downstairs. Other than this, I can't think of anything else that's nice about it. The hotel pool was small and looked like an oversized bath tub (about half the size of a normal pool and I'm not exaggerating). You're better off swimming in the warm, beautiful beaches. Hopefully, other travelers will have a much better experience (and better room) than what we had. Unfortunately, our experience is such that we probably won't come back here again unless they do some much needed work on their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Imperial Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Carla027
Reviews.Content: May 10 2008 We just returned home from a wonderful vacation in Hawaii (Oahu). We (4) of us, my husband ,our daughter ,her girlfriend and myself,staying at the Imperial Waikiki. Timeshare trade for the Hale unit, 2 bedroom 2 bath. I honestly will tell you what a great choice we made. The unit was on the 22nd floor with a wonderful view of the ocean from each room. If you don't happen to get a room with a view don't worry. They have an owners lounge (26th floor) which has everything. Offering a full kitchen for use, pool table, computers,a big screen television to enjoy . Lots of sofas and chairs for all. ....but also that fabulous view. We watched the fireworks go off Friday eve. over the Hilton Hawaiian Lagoon from the lounge. Also on the 27th floor is the pool and hot tub with great views also. We met timeshare owners of the Imperial owning for 30 years now. They return every year they said. 4 lovely elderly folks.This was the first year they recall the pool being kept heated and warm at 84 degrees. We never used the pool tho. with the beach a block away. We all enjoyed ourselves, the location is perfect! The girls (early 20's) partied every night til 4 am. at the clubs very close by. The Beachwalk is very upscale, fine dining a walk across the street, or other choices up the block. You'll have to stay there to appreciate the location without paying 5 star rates! The famous Pink Royal Hawaiian is 1 block up.We all enjoyed their Luau. Trumps new Tower (Condos) going up presently is a half block away. If that doesn't speak for itself on location. Oh save the car rental cost. Take a taxi from the airport. Just rent daily if needed, it's close by.. The cost to park over night at the Imperial is $25 a day. We only needed a car 2 days and rented daily, returning it back. Do drive up to Ko-Olina and the Lagoons available for public use. It's at the Marriotts Resort. Also enjoy driving the Island to North Shore.approx.( 3 hours.or less) Or call for a shuttle, as we did to get to the Arizona and Missouri. $12 ea.roundtrip. Hey a high 5 for all of us. We walked from the Imperial along Waikiki to Diamond Head. Then hiked up Diamond Head for it's incrediable view point!!! Of course we took the Bus back which you may take right outside the park. $2. each. Pick up a bus schedule at the hotel. Or walk. as we did. :o) Great exercise. in ending........ The staff (all of them) excellent and so helpful. Thank you Tony (reservations manager) for such a great room, which just added to our enjoyed time there. My husband and I enjoyed many cocktails on our lania watching the Beackwalk and activity below. I rate this hotel at the top. We would definetly plan another stay there if on Oahu again. Carla........ from California

Reviews.Title: “Imperial--Old Hawaiian Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Oahugirl12
Reviews.Content: Lewers St. has undergone a major renovation with Trump moving in the area. Imperial of Waikiki is in the process of deciding what renovations are needed to remain in this improved area while still maintaining its affordability. That being said, if you don't expect class A accomodations, you will be happy. The rooms are small but clean. You must like the people you are travelling with. You will not be able to make a gourmet dinner in most of the rooms, as the kitchens are mostly a dorm fridge, microwave, coffeepot. Some have small stoves or oven. Fresh towels and linens are available but requires you to get them as room service is only provided on a limited basis as this is mostly a timeshare type hotel. But you can get almost anything you want with a trip to housekeeping. Some room views are excellent, and others are very disappointing. Waikiki in general is like this. There does not appear to have been any urban planning when the high rise hotels went up. Each hotel got progressively bigger the closer to the ocean causing most hotels to lose unobstructed views. Parking in Waikiki is going to cost you your first born child anywhere. The Imperial raised their daily fee to $25.00, plus it is valet parking and you will need to include the tips on top of this. All of this being said, there are some of the nicest people employed by the Imperial Of Waikiki. Kona in the travel department can get you tickets and transportation to everything, RJ and the bellhops go out of their way to remember you. The service counter personnel were extremely polite and knowledgeable. I have stayed at the Imperial many times and I have also stayed at other, more expensive hotels in Waikiki, but I keep coming back because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CatsVillage
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Hawaii/Honolulu and we had a blast! Mahalo everyone. Now the hotel, remember folks this hotel is 2 star... who stays in the room in Hawaii??? Not us. We slept well and were treated better than at any hotel on the mainland that is a 3 or 4 star. The staff was great, so friendly and helpful. Loved having the ABC store on the main level. Yes the decor is dated, but it was clean and well maintained, I understand that the owners are slowly redecorating each room as they go. As to the construction, and we were on that side, so what???? again we were out all day and most of the evening enjoying the beauty of the island. It was good to know that Honolulu is moving ahead. Having the beach 1/2 block away was awesome, as well the bars in the hotels along the beach we so much fun, we met some wonderful folks including some military officers who were a gas to spend the evening with Aloha friends. We will return and have recommended this hotel to the sister and her family since it's so affordable. Thank you to all the staff at the Imperial MAHALO and we will be back, hopefully this autumn(2008) and this time we'll be checking out the timeshare options. ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Hansen5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice little hotel on Lewers street. Great service -we were allowed to check in early and had excellent service from the front desk and valet all week. They gave us great tips on restaruants and had even clipped coupons saving us a ton of money. Valet is extreemily promt almost too fast. We received every wake up call we asked for. The beds are comfy and it is nice to have a small kitchen and fridge. We stayed in a Palm unit with our 3 kids and felt the space was more than adequate and the extra bathroom makes a huge difference. Love the lanai's (Balcanies). We had 3 families staying in different units all traveling together and everyone had an excellent stay. Some units are more up to date than others but we spent most of our time at the various beaches and other activities out side the hotel-it's not the ritz, but it is great. It is a perfect base camp and we woke well rested every morning ready for adventure. The new shops and restaruants on Lewers street make this one of the best locations in waikiki. You have everything you need with in a few strides...literally. The beach is 3 minutes or less...enjoy all Waikiki has to offer from this perfect location! Nice pool and hot tub upstairs-the pool was a little chilly. Leave your beach towels at home you can check them out from the hotel...nice touch. Get with Kona for your island adventure activities she is the best! Small things like leaky shower nob easily overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Imperial!”
Reviews.Author: shimmerystars
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay! Spacious rooms and a friendly staff. The parking is a bit expensive at $25 a day but other than that everything was great. It is very close to the beach and to many restuarant, shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: shellbell09
Reviews.Content: The location for the Imperial was a definite plus, close to the beach, close to the stores and shops, and close to other key locations. The hotel facilities were quite comfortable and the staff had a very laid back attitude. They were more then willing to accomodate any needs we had. The tours offered were well worth it and not too costly. They have a cute little exercise room, but I found the pool area to be too small as well as the pool. It can get a bit cramped there. All in all, a nice and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAustin1953
Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel! We stayed in the 2 bdrm. Hala "Suite" at the Imperial of Waikiki for 7 days. We wanted to check out the day we got there! Bathroom sinks were chipped/cracked, front bathroom shower never drained water, carpets dirty, furniture from the 70's, two double beds in master bedroom! We had to sleep in separate beds - my husband was bitten by bed bugs!!! The rooms are outdated, the staff were nice until we complained, then refused to put us in another room. Found out that 25 rooms were being "repaired"! A Motel 6 would have been nicer and more updated. We will NEVER stay there again and don't recommend anyone stay there for health reasons! The whole building needs to be renovated from the ground up.

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased”
Reviews.Author: CoopVirginia
Reviews.Content: Resort in great location to beach and shopping. Room was above average. Accomodtions were not comparable to property in Orlando but it was clean and served it's purpose. Staff were ALL friendly and helpful. Stayed in 1 bedroom 2 bath with Murphy bed and pullout couch. Guest said the Murphy was comfortable. Decent work out facility. Highly reccommend. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Efficient, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: heuster
Reviews.Content: This was an alternative to the Fairfield property I reviewed earlier. It is also part of a timeshare program. If you overlook the dated decor, this place is very good. As you can see from the pictures, it had the Hawaiian floral printed cushions on white rattan. I was in a 1 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit. Pluses ~ The shower pressure was great and there was always hot water. The kitchenette had a microwave, coffee maker, toaster, stove, and dishwasher. There was plenty of utensils, plates, pots, etc. There was a small but adequate lanai, an iron and board, and hairdryers in both bathrooms. The best thing was the pull-down bed. It was very comfortable and unlike those worn out sofa-sleepers. On the third floor was the fitness center and even a sauna. There were washers and dryers on the second floor, which also had a t.v. The pool was located on the 27th floor and there were beach towels available. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Simple requests were handled promptly and professionally. Minuses ~ Elevators were a little slow at times. The AC seemed a little archaic, but adequate. I didn't like the gap underneath the door because warm air blew in. The only t.v. was in the living room. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. It wasn't as nice as the Fairfield property I stayed at last time. I spent most of my days exploring parts of Honolulu. I would stay here again because it's centrally located. There was not much construction noise while I was there, but they have not started on Trump tower yet, so that could change.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location at an Afforadable Price”
Reviews.Author: senorojo
Reviews.Content: Rented a one bedroom for a week from a timeshare owner. Room was on the 18th floor facing west. We had ocean and city views and Embassy suites hotel across the street. For un-obstructive views try to get a room above the 19th floor. The greatest asset of the Imperial is its location. It is centrally located to all the wonderful shops and restuarants of Waikik and directly across the street to the beach via the Holukalani Hotel. Staff is friendly and very helpful. While some may complain about the parking being $15. Parking in Waikiki is very costly and I found it to be reasonable with in and out privleges. We stayed 7 nights and just rented a car for 4 days more than enough time to see the other parts of the Island. The room was comfortable and equiped with a micro wave, sink and small refrigerator. While a cooktop would have been more convinient. The setup met our needs. The rooms do need some decorative updating thought they are clean and well kept. There is one TV with dvd player in the living room and murphy bed. A TV in the rather small bedroom would have been nice. the living room and bedroom each have balconies. There is a game room and computers (also wi-fi for those that bring there lap tops) on the 26th floor The game room also has large balconies which command incredible ocean/city lights/and mountain views. It is ideal place for viewing the Hilton's Friday night fireworks. the pool and jacuzzi are on the 27th floor. While the pool is small the 360 degree views are impressive. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the place. Strongly recommend the shore Bird cafe at the outriigger adjacent to the Halukulani Hotel. Has rgreat ocean front views and great night time entertainment. For take out I suggest CoCo Cove on Kalakaua Ave (between seaside avenue and Nohonani).

Reviews.Title: “Soon, it will be better”
Reviews.Author: mjgriffy
Reviews.Content: Oh the poor Imperial… While staying in Waikiki, I find that condominium buildings are more comfortable--and ultimately affordable-- than hotel rooms. The Imperial is conveniently located on Lewers Street in the heart of Waikiki and is a stone's throw from the beach. Lower units have no view, but upper units have ocean and territorial views. The interior of the building is quiet and secure, and there is a pleasant rooftop view pool. Most of the units that I have stayed in are dated but in modest/serviceable condition with small kitchenettes. The rooftop community lounge/tv/free computer/pool table/kitchen has a spectacular view. As of this writing (11/15/06) I would *not* recommend staying at the Imperial (or any other Lewers Street hotel) until late 2007 or 2008. There is *significant* construction and new hotel development in the area and it is noisy and dirty. After the neighboring Trump Hotel is complete, the neighborhood (and my rating) will improve significantly. In the past I have paid between $85-125/nt. You may find more information at the building's website. As always; I travel to Waikiki several times a year, I can advise that Waikiki is a nice tropical urban adventure. The city comes with the negatives of a big city, along with the overwhelming benefits of a beautiful beachfront resort. Generally, everything in Waikiki is “a little tired” although there have been continuous improvements in the last few years. If you are traveling solo, take Roberts Hawaii from the airport for $10 (no rsvr rqd). Two or more people, take a taxi from the airport to the hotel (should be under $30). In Waikiki, nearly everything is walking distance or a short shuttle/bus away. If you need a car for the day, you can rent one in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Economical Imperial of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: iNachoMan
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location this hotel is in the heart of Waikiki. A few yards in any direction and you find the best of Waikiki from restaurants, shopping and beaches. The rooms aren’t the most up to date, but for the price a comfortable bed and a clear TV will do. The hotel staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. The excursion desk staff helped us make our trip a memorable one. So if you’re looking for a comfortable, pleasant and economical hotel choose The Imperial of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: MEH3110
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I booked the studio through my RCI timeshare. I was nervous because of the past reviews posted on this site. I did not experience any of the problems reported by other travelers. (I did observe one gentleman at the front desk complaining about a leaky fridge.) This is not one of RCI's best properties but it suited our needs. Yes, it could use updating but the unit was clean, the appliances worked, the linens were in good condition and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom especially could use a remodel, but again, it was clean. The owners lounge on the top floor was very nice - the lobby was nice too. I left my daughter's book of DVDs in the unit (over $300 worth) and the staff made arrangements to get them back to me. You can't beat the location - right in the middle of everything and very close to the beach. I would book a unit here again. Downsides: $15 daily parking fees, no wi-fi in the unit itself (had to go upstairs) and a very small pool.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay @ the Imperial”
Reviews.Author: LifestooshortUknow
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 night visit to Hawaii. I bought a timeshare week from an owner who could not use it. I have stayed at several hotels around Waikiki. For the money, this is a great hotel. No, it is not a 4-5 star hotel as many other posters have indicated, but you are not paying those kinds of rates either- I would rate it as 3 stars. The rooms are dated & eventually need renovating in the near future. I was on the 15th floor facing Lewers St.. For the most part, the $460 million street renovation is done so the outside noise level is pretty much nil. The street is fabulous looking now. As far as I'm concerned, the room was clean, comfortable & much too my liking. Local calls are free. While I did not use the fully equipped kitchen except for the fridg, I thought it was very functional. The bed was firm & comfortable. There is TV with DVD player with a DVD rental plan in the lobby for only $3/day for 4 DVD's/day rental. Being a timeshare owners room, I was given full access to the owners lounge on the 26th floor. It had 4 desktop computers with full web access & unlimited wireless if you have your laptop with you, for free. It also has a pool table, big screen tv with several very comfortable black leather couches, full kitchen, & tables. But probably the best thing about it is the large balcony with an incredible ocean view. The front desk & valet staff were extemely friendly & helpful. The convenience of the ABC store & 24hr Denny's right outside the lobby is definitely a plus. Across the street the new Plaza has all the new high end eateries you can spend your money at if you dont want to use your kitchen. Location, location, location- you are only 100 yards away from the beach & in the thick of shopping. You are nestled amongst some of the most prominent & expensive hotels in Waikiki- Waikiki Sheraton, Halekulani, Royal Hawaiian paying much less. I consider myself pretty well traveled around the world & can tell you, for the money, it's hard to beat this hotel , all things considered. I was so impressed, I bought a week timeshare before I left. It's in escrow now. Just to give you an example of what a bargain it is, next door is the Fairfield timeshare hotel that was completely renovated inside & out is going for $21k to 41k versus Imperial hotel (exterior renovation only) @ $4k for a lifetime. If you are going to visit Waikiki every year & are half way interested in a timeshare program, I highly recommend you visit with Phil in the sales office in the lobby. You'll be glad you did. They don't have barkers standing outside their timeshare hotels trying to hook you in- they don't need it!

Reviews.Title: “Interval world”
Reviews.Author: Fifthwheel1955
Reviews.Content: We traded a week with Interval International. The stay was just above average. The hallways and rooms (22nd floor) smelled of cigarette smoke. It seems to move through the air conditioning. The rooms (studio) are in desperate need of upgrading. The bathrooms have cracked tile and are small. The valet service was agressive and poor. The only woman working at the valet counter was rude and agressive. The location was fantastic! It is probably in the best location in Waikiki. There is construction going on for the new beach walk. Try to book on the South Side of the location (not the Lewers Street side) as the noise starts early in the morning. The views are OK. The lanais have cheap plastic chairs and table. There is a very convenient ABC store in the lobby. Denny's is located right next door. The hotel is good for the gay travellers as it is only blocks from the best gay clubs in Waikiki. We would definately stay again but would be very specific about our request.

Reviews.Title: “imperial is lacking.... a lot!”
Reviews.Author: wowwhatagreatday
Reviews.Content: every 5 years, we attend the pearl harbor survivors reunion. we have stayed at the imperial in the past and it worked well for us in a 2 br, 2 ba suite. however, in the past 5 years, no apparent maintenance nor upgrades were done to the rooms and it is drastically needed. rooms should be much cleaner than this! the pull out bed was in such bad condition it had to be replaced with a regular bed to accommodate sleeping. two of the stove burners were out completely, the faucet could not be turned off to prevent constant dripping, the phone didn't work and daily maid service was non-existant. if we needed towels, soap, dishwasher detergent, etc, we had to go to housekeeping to get it ourselves. but the worst thing of all was the CONSTRUCTION NOISE LEVEL. impossible to sleep past 7am and believe it or not, they worked on sunday which meant 15 days of unbearable noise!!! the desk staff and concierge/valet staff was incredible but that hardly made up for the complete inconveniences. check your bill carefully. what should have been around $225 was more than double that amount and had already been charged to our credit card making it impossible to dispute the charges. until, or unless, improvements are made and charges are honest, we would not stay in this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Imperial”
Reviews.Author: Dukes_fan
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Imperial every summer since 1998 and wouldn't stay anywhere else; the location, friendly and courteous staff, very reasonable cost and great rooms and views are all important to me. A friend recommended it in '98 when my son was in the military there. Even though he is no longer there, I can't wait to return each year and enjoy everything Hawaiian. I highly recommend The Imperial!

Reviews.Title: “not a good value at all”
Reviews.Author: workin'guy
Reviews.Content: we had a two bedroom "suite" - the internet made this place look much nicer than it is - construction all around though not the fault of the hotel, BUT, surcharges for EVERYTHING - they even tack on a 5$ per night charge, which "covers" your video rental - we never once took a dvd to watch or had any intention of it, but they charged us anyway! it was non-negotiable! - the hotel is old and really unimpressive, even to a basic hotel - i'm not a snooty traveller demanding the best of everything - but i don't see a lot of service-life with this place left - it either needs to be torn down, renovated, or re-priced to reflect it's below average standards - for the price we paid, we could have been enjoying an oceanfront

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was good, not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Imperial with my family in July 2005. After being a little apprehensive (I had heard bad things things about the Imperial, such as bugs, a lot of noise, unfriendly staff, and the rooms being dirty), when I got to the hotel, none of the things I mentioned were true. Well, except for construction noise, which just can't be helped. The rooms (I stayed in two -- one for a night as a hotel room and the other room I spent an entire week in as a timeshare) were quite small but they were clean. The staff was great. They were really helpful with all of my family's many, many questions that week and they were very friendly. The location wasn't bad. We didn't have to walk far to get to some restaurants and some shops. It is recommended not go out alone or even in groups of two after dark in the neighborhood, though we never heard of anything happening while we were there. I would recommend smaller families to stay at the Imperial (Unless a larger family got the biggest room). It isn't exactly the most romantic of places for honeymooning couples but if you don't mind that, then this is a great place for just about anyone because it's not expensive like most hotels. I really enjoyed my stay at the Imperial Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Do YOu Like Loud Noise?”
Reviews.Author: dottykay
Reviews.Content: Never again! The only thing positive that I can say about this hotel is that it is close to the beach. However many of the lanais are locked off for repairs and the loud work starts early in the morning with a construction worker staring you in the face. The rooms are stuffy, shabby and dirty. The beds are also very uncomfortable. Don't expect help from the management because their attitude is, if you don't like it go somewhere else. Which is just what you should do.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Imperial over Christmas 2004/2005 and plan to return again this Christmas 2006. I was there with my husband and 4 children. The pull down beds made it possible for all of us to stay in one unit (Banyan Suite)i sitting room, 1 bathroom, 1 bedroom, mini kitchen (we had breakfast in our room most days). Yes it was a tight squeeze at bedtime but with the beds up during the day there was plenty of room to move around. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. We didn't spend much time in the room we were always out at the beach or exploring - who goes to Hawaii to sit in the room? We had a view of the ocean between two hotels and that was all we needed to check the weather and beach conditions. Our Teenagers loved all the activity in the city and we had a great time exploring the shops and restuarants. The beach was wonderful lots of people watching! great sunsets every night. We went to the northshore as well and loved the big waves and lack of crowds was a nice change. The hotel itself was clean, centrallly located and the right price for a family of 6! Our kids enjoyed the hot tub, the pool; looked fine we swam in the ocean though. We had no trouble with maid service or getting fresh towels whenever we needed them. The staff were always friendly and eager to help, we were always polite and friendly to them too!!! Christmas morning Santa even visited our room with a gift! We can hardly wait to return again this year. It is a great place to stay for a family, the suites make it affordable compared to individual rooms for a family of 4 or more.

Reviews.Title: “Imperial Well Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Franceisfine
Reviews.Content: We rented a private one-bedroom unit at The Imperial through VRBO (#39889). It was clean, bright & updated throughout. Our unit was spacious, had 2 bathrooms & 2 lanais with partial ocean views and a full (new) kitchen. Check in (& out) was friendly & efficient. Location can't be beat, even though there is alot of construction & noise right now. They quit by supper time & start up by 7:00 a.m or so. The towel exchange was handy. No need to bring beach towels as you can get clean ones daily. The lobby area is very nice although the pool area is tiny, but who needs it with the beach so close. The large ABC store at the base of the building carries everything. I would not hesitate to book again. It was perfect for our family of four including 2 older teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sure - its in the middle of a construction war zone - but the accomodations were great, the staff very friendly and accomodating - very close to the beach at a backstreet price - clean condo unit - everything worked - pool was very clean - and an ABC store right off the lobby kept us in fresh fruit, guava juice, and sweetbread whenever we wanted without a schlepp across town. Two Starbucks within 3 block radius - great breakfast special at Chief's Hut at Outrigger Hotel - one block away - 4 blocks from Kalakaua Ave and massive shopping choices. Booked our stay through a broker in LA - very scary - had to pay w/ check - no credit. Taking kids to HI for first time with disabled spouse so was terrified that I would show up to no room avail - was I ever wrong. Staff was absoulutely charming from valets (car retrieval never took more than 3 minutes) to front desk staff to housekeeping. Now about that war zone - major multi year construction project on hotels on north and west side of Imperial - was noisy as heck during day 6:30 AM - 5:00 PM - but we were at the beach or upstairs at pool - could still see water and sunset from lanai - but if you are not an early riser not sure what you can do. Daughter and I had a blast watching construction activity - huge crane, full day concrete pour, etc. Overall - glad we avoided the "huge city" atmosphere of Hilton Hawaiian and overpriced closets at other hotels - we had plenty of room for 4 in 1 BR/2 BA suite. Met several "I come here every year" families at pool or on elevator - I hope to be able to say that some day - will return when possible

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: EvilTigger26
Reviews.Content: I knew that my friend and I would be staying in one of the small rooms. We had a murphy bed and couch. We were pleasantly surprised with our small ocean view from the balcony. It was quiet and roomy enough for us. The kitchen area makes the room feel bigger. The bathroom wasn't huge, but fit our needs. We didn't go to Oahu to spend the trip in our room. We had no problems with the staff. It was great being so close to the shops and beach. In the middle of everything! We wanted some nightlife and to be able to walk around w/o always needing a rental car. We did rent a car for part of the trip because we wanted to check out the whole island and I'm glad that we did. A lot of places were undergoing renovations or some sort of construction. This didn't affect our trip at all. We still had a great time and can't wait to go back! Snorkeling, horseback riding, hiking, relaxing - it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Imperial Hotel was the worst experience. It basically put a big damper on my trip. It all started with loose change and dollar bills going missing within our room. We could handle that, but what really upset me the most was how we were treated like complete dummies when asking for help within the lobby area (especially the front desk). The day-shift staff at the front desk wouldn't give us the time of day when we would ask for directions to our destinations or bus times. They would simply give us an "I dunno, ask someone else". They were not hospitable at all, they made me feel extremely uncomfortable. The same day-shift clerk even accused me of losing a DVD rental that we didn't even rent. Later that day they found the DVD which was rented to another room, and not once did I get an apology. We were given dirty looks by the two day-shift front desk employees everytime we stepped off of the elevator for the rest of our trip. Also, I put up the 'do not disturb' sign one day while we went out to the beach, and I came back to find the towels in my bathroom replaced. This instantly made me mad, as we had money previously taken. We spent the next two hours going through our stuff making sure nothing was missing. Then, to top everything off, our checkout time was at 11 a.m., but unfortunately our flight didn't leave until 9:00 p.m. so reluctantly we had to leave our luggage with the hotel. When we arrived to pick up our luggage, we briefly looked through it all to make sure all of our belongings were still there. We did this within 10 minutes, as our shuttle bus had arrived early to pick us up. Everything looked fine, until I realized at the airport that I didn't remember seeing the macadamian cookies on top of my clothing when I searched before we left. When I arrived, I unpacked my luggage and sure enough, I discovered I was missing them. It wasn't too important but it really made me mad. My mom had asked me to bring home a couple of boxes of macadamian nut cookies (which are not available where I am from). They had opened up my suitcase and taken the cookies out when we left our luggage there. I packed them on top of my clothing. They had the nerve to steal from my bag! For all those planning a trip here, be very aware of your possessions. If you unfortunately have booked here, you'll understand what I mean when I say they really lack hospitality. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, not in a million years!

Reviews.Title: “Miss This One”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to be at this hotel for seven nights. Everyone of my requests for accomodations was denied. They did move us from the original room on the bottom floor to a room with a view of the parking ramp next door. I have returned to this hotel five times in the last seven years. Each time the service has deteriorated. This is the last time I will stay there. We left after three nights and checked into the Sheraton down the beach. We traded the view of the parking ramp for a view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The difference was total service and a view for a couple of hundred dollars more. It was well worth it. I have leaqrned my lesson. I hope the readers of this review will not limit the enjoyment a Hawaiian vacation can be by staying at this locaiton. Hawaii is a great place to visit. We return every year and enjoy the Aloha Spirit. We will not be returning to the Imperial Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Chloe7122
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vactation and had spent one week at the Imperial. We stayed on the 23rd floor and had a terrific view of the ocean. We would sit on our balcony (there were 2) and watch the surfers and boats every morning on the ocean. I was told only the floors 20 and up had ocean views. The condos are small, but we were out so much it never bothered us. The room was very, very clean. Maid service was only once a week, but they came every day to empty our trash and there was a portable vacuum in the room so we could pick up the sand ourselves. The staff was very friendly to us, gave us good advice and the valets were really quick to bring us our rental car. The entrance is hard to find and not clearly marked. The pool is very small (roof top) but we found very few people went in the pool so our family had it mostly to ourselves. The view was great on the top floor. The beach is only a block away. I found the beach terrific by the Imperial, really close to all the other hotels. Easy access to the beach and back, either through public assess paths or through the other hotels. Bottom line, this is not a top hotel, but we loved the casualness of the place and found that the service was really friendly. There is construction all around the hotel but our side didn't have any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: monakayk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our vacation on Oahu, and I had to post my personal comment concerning The Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki-Honolulu, HI. First and formost...this is the worst and dumpiest hotel I have ever stayed in! Usually we stay in moderate priced hotels such as: Comfort Inns, Days Inns and Holiday Inns, so we are not the type of people who normally stay in the so called 'best' hotels so our standards for a hotel requirements are mainly for good value, clean rooms & bathrooms and good service for the right price. However, at the The Imperial Hawaii Resort...these standards were not meet at all. The Imperial Hawaii Resort is a timeshare...I want to caution people NOT to buy into this resort...if you want to even call it a resort. You can book suites here if you are not a member of the time share program---which I would not recommend. We stayed in the 3rd level of the suites in the 'PALM SUITE' with a price range of: $258-$271. This so called suite had one bedroom, which hardly had room enough to get around the bed from one side to the other. There was no dresser in the bedroom...the TV had to be mounted on the wall. The bathroom adjoining the bedroom was so small that only one person could be in there at a time. I could've washed my hands, used the toilet and washed my feet in the shower (no tub) at the same time if I wanted too--that is how small it was. The sink--had no counter area at all to it, therefore I had to place toiletries items on top of the toilet tank! There was only room for a glass near the sink which we placed our toothbrushes in. In the living room there was a pull-down double bed, and small. Also in the living room was a small dinning table that was virtually useless because when the bed was pulled down we had to shove the table up to the window just to make room for the bed. The coffee table had to be slide up to the couch to make room to walk around the bed when it was pulled down. The dinning chairs (no arm chairs at all!) had to be moved each night to the kitchen area to make room for the bed. Again, the TV had to be mounted on the wall due to limited space in the living room area. As for the so called 'full kitchen' this again was a joke for a suite at this price range. There was a very small microwave, dishwasher and only a mini refrigerator that bearly had room for a few items. There was a stove with an oven on top of it that looked like it dated back to the early 70's and didn't work well at all! A coffee maker was in the kitchen....but no coffee, sugar or creamer was provided. We had never stayed at a hotel, let alone a resort, with a coffee maker in our room and coffee was not provided. Even in a Comfort Inn...coffee, sugar, creamer are in the rooms that provide coffee makers...but not at this 'resort'!!! So bring your or plan on buying a small jar of instant coffee for $3.95 in the store and plan on drinking it black or you will have to buy sugar and creamer too. The second bathroom was not much better...the only difference with the size of it compared to the one connected to the bedroom was it did have a bathtub with shower. However, the sink-counter area was still no larger. As for cleaniless....we had to call housekeeping the minute we got into our suite because both bathrooms had mildrew on the tiles! Housekeeping did show up later that evening while we were at dinner and 'tried' to clean it...but there still remained mildew on many of the tiles throughout our stay. Mainly due to the fact that these bathrooms had not been cleaned properly in years and not renovated at all since the 70's when it was first built, therefore the mildew was so embedded in the grout of the tiles...it would not come out! The maid service here was only once in 7 days....therefore we only received clean towels once or we could personally go down to housekeeping and get more on our own! Remember...this is a 'resort' suite and with a price range of almost $300 a night and we had to get our own towels. Even when we called housekeeping and asked for more..they refused to bring them to us. The floors were only vacuumed once in 7 days. The linens on the beds were never changed in 7 days and the bed in the bedroom was only made up once. The pull-down bed was never made up or linens changed at all in 7 days! The bathrooms were only cleaned once in 7 days...other than the extra cleaning we got because of our complaint of the mildew on the tiles our first day, which the bathrooms should've been cleaned properly to begin with before we checked into the suite! As for location...it is a very good location for right downtown Waikiki shops and dinning. Only one block to many nice places, but there was construction all around the hotel, therefore making it loud with noise first thing in the morning till 5 PM at night. This, I understand, will not continue forever...but during our visit it was very disturbing. The walk to the beach was short...but the beach was the worst I have ever been to with major hotels right on it and located on Waikiki. The sand (if you call it that) going into the ocean was full of large rocks--not pebbles--but ROCKS! So large in fact that if I wasn't careful walking into the ocean...I could've turned my ankle. So needless to say, we did not swim at this beach...but ended up walking down quite a ways to a better beach. So much for a close beach area to our hotel---NOT! If you wanted to sit on the beach...that was limited too. The beach area was very small and was surrounded by a stone wall that went up to a walkway because of the massive erosion of the beach in this area. So sandy beach area was extremely limited. The pool area was not much better. There was no view of the ocean but out one window. There is a huge, tall brick wall all around the pool area due to the fact it is located on the roof of the building. I understand that this wall is necessary for safety sake, however with the safety glass or plastic that is available (and used) in many hotels with this same type of pool arrangement nowadays, I would think this hotel could've upgraded the pool-wall with this type of material instead of a brick wall with very small windows. I felt very closed in...even though I was totally outside and on top of a building! The only redeeming thing I can say about this hotel is on the top floor there is an 'owners lounge'--which only time share holders can use. Regular hotel guest are NOT allowed in this lounge. Our friends who we went with are time sharers. So we were able to use the lounge. The view of the ocean was wonderful from the lounge. Nice arm chairs...tables and couches were in it...also a pool table. We stayed here quite a bit because we felt like we had more room to move around in than in our suite...which is very sad in my opinion seeing the cost of the suite in which we stayed in! Even enjoying this lounge had it's downfalls...no personal privacy. Other time share members used it also (as they should) so we felt like we had to talk quietly as we would in any other public place. As I stated before, our friends are time share holders and traded their points to be able to go to Hawaii. They had no choice about where they could stay...therefore they had to stay at this hotel. Needless to say, they were shocked, disappointed and very embarrassed about this hotel, because they had invited us to come with them on vacation. They stated that this hotel was the worst they have ever stayed in in their 7+ years as time share holders. That is why I felt it necessary to warn others about this hotel. Even if you have no intentions in buying into the time share...please reconsider even staying here at all. It is a DUMP!!! I am not being hard with saying this...only truthful. I would've much rather been a few blocks further from the beach and had a much nicer suite or even a single room with 2 queen beds in it than have stayed here. Kay Mixson

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Viajar1
Reviews.Content: My original timeshare destination to Puerto Rico was not granted and had to settle for Waikiki. This is my 4th trip to Hawaii; previous trips were to Maui and Kauai. I was booked at the Imperial and was a little apprehensive about staying there after reading the reviews and receiving a letter from RCI about the construction around the resort. I even tried to change it at last minute, but was unable to. I am used to staying at 5 star hotels, but boy, was I pleasantly surprised. It was not at all what I expected. The front desk was very courteous; they even allowed us to check in early. The parking attendants were always very friendly. We had a one bedroom suite on the 12th floor. The room was clean...no mold in the showers; and even the murphy bed was comfortable. We did not have a full front ocean view but we were able to get a glimpse of it from the lanai. We were in a city high rise and most of the views were of the surrounding hotels. However, the sunset view from the 26th floor of the owner's lounge all but made up for it. The noise and construction was to be expected; and driving through it was no different than driving in Los Angeles, San Francisco or New York City. As for the noise, again, Waikiki is a city. If you've ever stayed in any other hotel in a busy city, noise is a given...even without the construction. We enjoyed our shopping sprees. The resort is conveniently located a few steps from the "Rodeo Drive" of Waikiki. However, no one goes to Hawaii to stay in the hotel. A short drive away from Waikiki on H1 will take you to the most beautiful beaches in the world. We found our own secluded beach spot and spent a day swimming and snorkeling...even saw a few sea turtles for free! Our last night was spent on Waikiki beach (which was 100 steps from the resort) watching the sunset and listening to the Hawaiian music being played at the Outrigger. It was such a wonderful vacation, we decided to purchase a timeshare week at the Imperial for 1/4th the price of other resorts in the area. It is an older hotel and not a 5-star world class resort; but once the dust from construction settles in 2007, the Imperial Resort will be in the middle of one of the hottest spots in Hawaii...a place that is definitely worth returning to every year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but lacked class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exchanged a week and did not expect the Ritz. Room was adequate but needed updating. View was of a construction site but we had been warned and this was not a major issue as we spent most of the time away from hotel, just need to know this if you are looking to use hotel. Construction also going on around the hotel so some of the sidewalks closed. Biggest grumble was maid service only had one clean mid week and that was poor to say the least. Had to get fresh towels and as maid only came once also had to take old ones down. Lifts were slow and only three for 26 floors, pool was tiny. Plus was location it was as stated 100 yards from the beach and travel firm in hotel lobby provided good value and good trips (recomend full island tour with ENOA especially if you get Shannon as the tour guide). Also free scuba lesson given in pool which went down well with my son. Staff were ok but did not go that extra mile, did not seem happy in their jobs when compared to nearby hotels, even the few fish in the tank behind them looked fed up! Only one restauarant on site and that was a Dennys. ABC store was a bonus and the staff there always had a smile. Entrance of the hotel was a bit of a non-event, difficult to find on first night. If I was an owner here I would have serious questiions about service and standards this is the only time I have not had daily maid service. If you want basic standards then you will do fine with this hotel, island was great will go back and hopefully travel to other islands but will not use the Imperial again

HotelInfo.Name: The Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki
HotelInfo.Address: 205 Lewers St., Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815
